"Moonrise Kingdom" boasts a number of marquee stars who may has well have been passersby plucked off a street and whisked to the set for this Wes Anderson quirkfest. The actors, young and adult, are essentially stuffed costumes whose performances are throttled and limited to the point they seem like lifeless animatronic creations. Oh, wait, I suppose that is the point.

After all, this movie is a stylized animation parading as though it has real people. The scenery is real, though filmed as though it was the sort of fake background we were supposed to ignore in the earlier days of film because we could not take our eyes off the star power.

Somewhere embedded in this glop is a story, but it is hard to care much about the young runaways because every emotion and reaction is too stilted and scripted to elicit any empathy. I think the only thing in the movie that raised a bit of concern for me was thinking how bad beer would taste when poured into an unrinsed glass that had had milk in it.

I wish I could get the time I spent watching this flick added back to however many hours I still have on this earth.
It was very enjoyable, if you like things slightly off the beaten path.  I happen to love it that way.

While this is no academy award winner, it answers a desperately needed call of something that provides both some quality social commentary and good natured good humor. Reminds me of a few other campy films but clearly stands alone in themes and storyline. While some big names may have done this as a tax write off, it's well worth the time - perhaps more than once.

*** This review may contain spoilers ***

Rating: 2.5 out of 5.0

 Some may say 'Moonrise Kingdom' is charming and whimsical. Others might say it's simply trivial. Perhaps the best assessment is somewhere in between. One thing for sure is that the cinematography is a visual feast. Set in 1965 on the fictional New England island of New Pezance, it was actually shot around Narragansett Bay in Rhode Island.

'Moonrise' is formulaic up to a point. Quirky comedies usually feature protagonists who are outsiders, non-conformist, slightly emotionally unstable and victims of persecution by an established order. In this case, Sam Shakusky and Suzy Bishop fit the bill. A year before the break into the 'Second Act' where Sam and Suzy run off to their 'Moonrise Kingdom', they become pen pals after meeting at a church performance of Noye's Fluddle. A year later, Sam, who has a history of acting out behavior, finds himself ostracized by his Scout troop and then is dropped by his foster family after he disappears at his 'Khaki Scout' summer camp. Suzy comes from a more 'stable' family of dysfunctional attorney parents but also has behavior problems, and ends up running off with her 'soul mate', the equally troubled Sam.

Quirky comedies also feature a group (or groups) who persecute our quirky heroes. In this case, Sam is the subject of vituperation by his scout troop. Similarly, Suzy is rejected by her parents, who have no tolerance for her rebellious ways. Perhaps the most unpleasant scene in 'Moonrise Kingdom' is when the Scout Troop attempts to chase down Sam out in the forest. Fortunately, director Wes Anderson later redeems his antagonists. The scout troop realizes that they've been bullying Sam and finally decide to help him. Suzy's parents also realize the error of their ways and employing their legal acumen, aid Captain Sharp as he adopts Sam and prevents the Social Services matron from hauling Sam off to the Juvenile Refuge.

With both actors playing wondrously against type, Bruce Willis and Edward Norton as Captain Sharp (Bruce Willis) and Scout Master Randy Ward (Edward Norton), also play characters worthy of redemption. Sharp, who's been having an affair with Suzy's mother, Laura Bishop, ends the affair and later nobly adopts Sam. And Randy, who initially loses his scout troop after they split camp aiding Sam, saves his superior, Commander Pierce, after Pierce demotes him for incompetence. Only the Social Services matron, who represents bureaucracy, finds no redemption in Anderson's redemptive pageant.

'Moonrise Kingdom' feels a bit too long especially when Sam and Suzy run away TWICE. And we also see one too many chases throughout the film. Nonetheless, Wes Anderson employs a number of great creative touches that distract us from the drawn out narrative. I'm referring of course to the fictional books he creates for Suzy as well employing the marvelous Benjamin Britten music.

One must realize that Anderson's characters are farcical types--not meant to be at all realistic. Rather, he's gently poking fun at those neurotic type of adults who lack insight into their own behavior. Fortunately, Anderson ends things on a positive note, as most of the adults such as the Bishops and Captain Sharp, redeem themselves in the end. As for Sam and Suzy, it's sort of like the kid's version of 'Silver Linings Playbook'--amusing up to a point but slightly over baked. When all is said and done, 'Moonrise' is sometimes a little too cute for its own good. But look a little closer and you'll also see it's a tale of the power of redemption--which is no small thing.

Every heterosexual boy (other sexual orientations and identifications can speak to their own dreams, and chaste lusts), every heterosexual boy in Frank Jackman's  old corner boy working- class neighborhood anyway in oceanside Hullsville just outside of Boston, when he came of age, maybe at twelve maybe a little older  (rule of thumb for coming of age: when he saw those same elementary school classmate girls, or a stray girl or two around the neighborhood who went to private school, hell, really Catholic school in that neighborhood and thus even more exotic, that the previous year were nothing but distractions and nuisances to a corner boy orderly world had magically become, well, interesting) had his dreams of  finding his fair Rosamund and taking her, and them far away from the dreary day to day madnesses that they both faced. Taking that fair damsel drenched in some Sir Walter Scott medieval knightly romance saga from, you know, the endless parent civil wars traps, the other guys, your so-called best corner boy friends, who had no time for girls trying to cut your time trap, the school madnesses and assorted villainous teachers and other authorities trap, and worse, worse the raging hormonal (homicidal?) madnesses trap. And while in those days, those halcyon 1950s days, when it was a very close thing indeed whether we collectively of the earth would blow ourselves to kingdom come that dream, that Frank Jackman dream, looked and felt something like this movie set a decade later.
I didn't understand the point of this movie at all.  It's as bad as Beasts of the Southern Wild.  Don't waste your time or money on this one.

It took me a little while and a few viewings to really appreciate this movie, but as an avid Wes Anderson fan, I knew I would love it before I even saw it. This movie is really fun but a bit too stylized for my taste. The alternative style is a bit distracting at times but all in all it's funny and entertaining.

better than the sex that you thought you always wanted but could never find a girl to do that for you. that's how good it is
My favorite Bruce Wills movie..if you know someone that was ever in the Boy Scouts this movie is a must see..a very cute story

We haven't enjoyed a movie so much in a long time.  The characters were played to perfection - no matter if they had a bit part or were in the whole movie.  It was one of those movies where you do NOT want it to end.  The young actors (children) were believable and absolutely great! I LOVE this film. Just the right balance of A-list and alternate-list actors. Stunningly atmospheric settings and soundtrack, good plot, and happy ending.  But this is a dark and strange film although the characters and dialogue are so authentically quirky that it does not oppress.

A compelling script with interesting well developed characters, not to mention a host of solid performances.  These films of Wes Anderson's have layers and call out for repeated viewings. I look forward to many more films from this wonderful director.

I'm a fan of Wes Anderson's early films and have been pretty disappointed with his recent efforts. I thought Darjeeling Limited was terrible and Fantastic Mr. Fox was mediocre at best. However, I'm happy to report that Moonrise Kingdom is great! Check it out. The child actors are wonderful and Bruce Willis, Ed Norton, Bill Murray are great.
Just one of those quirky movies filled with incredibly interesting characters.  The cast is terrific and really delivers.  I would watch it again just to see what I missed the first time around.
As a huge Wes Anderson fan, which I guess skews my opinion, Moonrise Kingdom does not disappoint. An engaging story, and visually stunning. A must have for my family's film collection.
If you liked Rushmore, Bottlerocket or the other odd Wes Anderson movies, you'll love this one.  Might be my favorite.
would rate this movie poor. bad acting and the plot was slow and dull. no story line and tuened it off b/c too dull.

this lovely film blends the joy of young love with the sadness of love faded - the usual collection of sharply-drawn Wes Anderson characters in various stages of love. Moments of sheer delight in the settings, genuineness of dialog, and music. The little pauses and silences Anderson uses in his scripts allow those moments to shine as characters pause to process something they've seen or just been told; few others capture the way that children observe the world like this fine director.

Mr. Anderson is possibly the greatest film maker of our time.  Not some cookie cutter carry-on of the Hollywood genre; a genuine story teller.  Yes, he seems quirky, but isn't life quirky?  He gets great performances out of great performers and tells a story that seems simple and beautiful, but....Wait, that's all you need.  It is simple and beautiful.  Rock on Mr. Anderson.  I've loved every one of em.
Wasn't quite sure the first time we watched it, we have now watched it three times and each time it seems to get better.
This is a love film--I adore the humor and the sheer level of honesty in the characters and their development. Another great job, Wes!

What can I say. I love this movie. The dialogue is "quirky" and amusing, and the story line just keeps on getting better.  Moonrise Kingdom has a fabulous cast, and each cast member is perfect for his/her role. I am a movie buff, and this was my favorite movie of 2012.
I liked that there were a huge variety of actors in the movie, espechially Ed Norton in comedic role.  Other than that I don't know what to say. It was pretty wacky!

We really like this movie.  It is quirky, sweet, funny and all the actors (good actors too) fit right into the odd storyline and flow of the movie.  The two young people who play Suzy and Sam are fabulous, morose, goofy, and sweet.  And I love the turn around of the 'scouts' (bullies) to support the 'lovers' later.  And Bruce Willis as the 'sweet' town sheriff/cop was a nice role for him.
This movie is delightfully quirky, rich with detail, humor and tenderness.  I seldom watch a movie several times in a short period of time, but I have this one because of  the qualities I mentioned.
If you liked The Royal Tennenbaums, The Life Aquatic, The Darjeeling Ltd. then you would like this movie. x x
I guess I had preconceived notions of it being more of a comedy.  It was a very quirky movie, which I did like, but was disappointed in Bruce Willis' performance/

and laugh longly and outloud. it isn't going to be for everyone, but if you are willing to accept the absolute absurd and have an odd ball sense of humor, this could be for you. and if you want to see bruce willis with highwaters and white socks, then definitely. that alone will make ya laugh

I absolutely love Wes Anderson movies, and this is no exception.  It is beautifully filmed, with great dialoge, interesting characters,  and wonderful music. I really love the story and how everything unfolds.  My only complaint is that this is a love story between 2 kids and so it made it very hard to identify with them personally.  I prefer the adult actors in this movie,  whom all dis a wonderful job.  This movie is fun,  and I highly recommend it,  especially if you enjoy slightly off center comedy.

Good movie, I'm a fan of the director and his other movies. This is one of his best movies.  The worst of his movies was the one on the train which seemed like 20 hours,  that one was so bad I can't even remember the name of it.

What a wonderfully charming movie. Quirky and understated, yet very heartwarming. Certain well worth seeing by anyone and everyone.

If the best you can do is generic Hollywood blockbusters, fine, more power to you, but if you don't check out wonderful independent films like this you are losing out on some great cinema.

Great odd characters that add up to a fun mix.
Entertaining and always moving. Dull moments hard to find in a Wes Anderson movie.

Definitely for art house movie lovers.  Quirky and fanciful.  Two youngsters who are outsiders find each other and run away.  You will identify with various feelings and scenes, depending on your own first love experiences.

Highlights were Bruce Willis and Ed Norton. Little disappointed with Bill Murray's character because I love Bill Murray and he should comprise at least 1 hour of every movie. Moonrise Kingdom is okay.
I don't understand why this movie was so critically acclaimed.  Inappropriate scenes, very boring.  My whole family missed the point of this movie and was glad when it finally ended.
definitely on the weird side, this movie was however such a pleasant surprise. best movie i've seen in many months. highly recommended!
everything about this movie is great.  i am a longtime fan of wes anderson and this does not disappoint.  every frame of this film is filled with a richness of detail that is hard to capture.

Great movie, good blu ray.  Wes Anderson's movie are unique, and this one is no exception.  If you like quirky comedies, you will like this movie, and probably other Wes Anderson films too (Darjeeling Limited, The Royal Tenembaums, Life Aquatic, etc.)

Another amazing addition to the Wes Anderson library of amazing films. With his signature style and color schemes this is an easily lovable movie with an amazing cast and story. You're going to want to buy this. like now.
Decent movie with a good cast.  A little quirky and at times slow, but I think most people will enjoy this.
This DVD came with no scratches although it was used.  I had no problems watching it all the way through.
My son and I are both in scouting and thought this was hilarious.  It was a good clean movie for all to see, although there were a couple scenes that may be inappropriate for young views.
It's a very funny, offbeat story about teenage angst with a wonderful supporting cast.  I would recommend it to anyone.

This movie follows in the same vein as Wes' other movies- set in the mid -late 60's, lots of quick wit and funny banter. The story follows a runaway Boy Scout trying to find his true love.

I loved this movie and I think if you liked any other Wes Anderson movie then there is no question- you should watch this.

Like I said above, I thought this was the best Wes Anderson movie ever - and I'm not necessarily that big of a fan.  But this one really spoke to me: I'm from the "period" of the film. (Yipes, I love having to say that - at least there were no dinosaurs in it ...)  I was also involved in the Boy Scouts and in a production pf Benjamin Britten's "Noyes Fludde."  So, what's not to like?  I thought all the performances were absolutely top notch!
this was a wonderful film. phenomenal casting. well written screenplay. takes one back to those awkward between years of long ago.

Moonrise Kingdom is another beautiful and thoughtful film from Wes Anderson. An coming of age story with beautiful scenery, and a well-rounded cast. I enjoyed his usual cast in their new roles. Bruce Willis was great.

Although... I did miss the Wilson Brothers just a little!

Good quality blu ray transfer, good special features and digital copies. The movie I felt was pretty good but not his best still, I recommend it. If your new to the Wes Anderson world I wouldn't recommend starting off with this movie
Brought me back to my childhood. Beautiful cinematography. Very enjoyable to watch, made me happy ! Would recommend it to anyone , any age.

I saw this movie in the theater and absolutely loved it. It was the perfect blend of sweet, funny, interesting, charming, touching...I can't say enough good things about this movie. The performances from the entire cast are wonderful. I haven't been this impressed with a movie that touches all aspects of what good movie should be in a very long time.

That being said, I don't know that this movie is for everyone. There are some parts of it that may be shocking or distasteful to more conservative-minded folks and its odd humor may not sit well with everyone. Unfortunately, there's nothing I can compare this movie to in order to give you an idea if you might like it...it's just that unique of a movie.
If you haven't seen this movie, don't hesitate to purchase it because you will love it. Everything in it is just great. It's very Wes Anderson, if you know what I mean.

This movie entertains as it teaches lessons regarding the value of people who may appear "different" and how actions and unkind words are hurtful. My husband and I found it charming and quirky. We were laughing out loud at some of the scenes, loved the characterization and style. Khaki scouts rule!
Best movie of 2012!!! I've already seen this movie three times. Can't wait to own it myself. It should have won an Oscar!!

Very quirky. Very different, but it is wonderful through and through. It's almost like watching fantastic mr. fox. but a different story, different characters live action, if that makes sense. I would buy this. I would watch this again. Great movie, if you love a quirky story.
Such a cute and quirky movie, something I will probably watch again. Everything came properly, and I will be watching again!

Quirky, charming and fun. A refined version of Anderson's style and worthy of being in your movie library. If you enjoyed The Life Aquatic, The Darjeeling Limited or The Fantastic Mr. Fox, you'll enjoy this.

This was totally my kind of film, from the quirky characters, to the fanciful soundtrack, to the vividly composed cinematography. It was like watching a series of photos, while reading classic teen lit. I am enchanted.
Another great Wes Anderson movie.  I love the way his movies are filmed and the sarcasm of his characters.  Makes me feel like a kid when I watch them.

I was reading through some of the 1 star reviews and had to throw in my rebuttal. The only people who could give this movie one star are overprotective mothers and those who would probably enjoy something like 'Madea Goes to Jail'. Anybody who's immature enough to even remotely associate this movie with child pornography is a pervert and shouldn't be watching movies in the first place.

Wes Anderson movies aren't for people who can't comprehend the simple things in life. Try slowing down and paying attention to the world around you from time to time. I enjoy every detail in this movie (and all of Anderson's movies for that matter). Each time I watch it I see more things I didn't notice before.

The only thing not to like about this movie is that it's not long enough! If you can't handle small details or subtle humor, then go back to watching 'Fast and the Furious' or 'Madea' or something that your tiny brain can handle.

This movie was quirky and different but I found it very slow and really not that entertaining so I can't jump on the band wagon here with all the 4 & 5 star reviews. I feel like people think it's hip to love anything with Edward Norton and gave this movie a little too much credit because he was in it.
I love Wes Anderson. This is a great movie just like all of his works. I am continually impressed with Wes and the actors in his films.
this is a lazy sunday movie. grab popcorn curl up and laugh cheer.  makes you giggle a little...  would recommend

I love it! Is an amazing movie, so perfect!!!
And the quality of the discs was perfect. A delicious movie :)

Worth the rental price but I can't say this is a better film than Darjeeling Limited (which I personally enjoy the most of Wes Anderson's films), Life Aquatic or Fantastic Mr. Fox.

If you like Wes Anderson then you should enjoy this film.
Wes Anderson's best film yet.  Edward Norton with a fantastic performance, and the kids are great. Would definitely watch again.
Typical solid Wes Anderson movie. Odd camera shots, odd plot line, the always present odd boy in love with a manic pixie dream girl. Wes does not disappoint.

I truly enjoyed this movie. It was sweet and campy and just a treat. I always like the work of Norton & McDormand. Willis was a pleasant surprise. Definitely not his usual character & he did a very nice job. Murray was also very good in his part. The kids stole the show, though. Jared Gilman & Kara Hayward were so perfect.

Overall enjoyable and funny yet a bit dark. Bruce Willis once again the man who makes it right.
No issues with video quality

What in the world?  I attempted to watch this movie 3 times!  I figured I must have missed something being that there were so many 5 star reviews!  I found the characters annoying and the plot unbelievable.  Sorry, just didn't do it for me.  I was quite disappointed because I wasted so much time trying to get SOMETHING out of this movie...well that was like squeezing blood from a rock!

What a surprise! An absolutely charming movie. The cast is excellent and the setting is simple and straight forward. It is more than a coming of age story. Two young people are finding friendship and respect in a world of dysfunctional adults. There is no overblown music and it is spare in presentation. It was a great find.

I think Wes Anderson films are an acquired taste so this film is not for everyone, but I really like this film.  The cinematography is very similar to other Anderson films.  Many closeups, sets that are a cut away of an entire house, and somber but appealing color tones. The story is pretty outlandish yet works on many levels, with quirky characters and no one character or actor taking the limelight.  The kids, Sam and Suzy are very ordinary, but I liked that.  However, the first 'kiss' scene on the beach is smokin sexy!  Made me remember what is was like to be 16 again.

If you have scene Royal Tannebaums and hated it, you probably will not like this movie.  If you are up for something different than the crap Hollywood has been coming out with, give this film a try.

I was twelve years old in 1965, and part of a dysfunctional scout troop. The experience of enjoyment and appreciation for this film has not diminished over six viewings, and I continue to have real enthusiasm for sharing it with friends and family.

Very off-the-wall, funny, poignant, and able to entertain people of varied interests... I show this one when I don't want to offend people's political sensibilities, and don't know whether certain dramas or darker comedies or cult classics would be appropriate for all whom will be watching. No one has failed to enjoy it thus far, and my friends and family are a diverse lot.

If you have ever been young and in love and had a "different" kind of family life, this is your movie.  It is reminiscent of every person who ever had a young crush and dreamed of having a "different" family when they were growing up.
Could NOT get into this movie....sorry I rented it...didn't watch the whole thing...do not recommend it....confusing...and odd...rented it for the actors but was disappointed

Living in Rhode Island I loved the local scenery and recognized a few extras in the Boy Scout scenes but really strained to appreciate the story line. Special effects were hokey - but they were suppose to be, so that was weird. Acting was wonderful and I loved the time and effort put into creating each scene. Kudos to the set designer and director. Masterfully crafted but the screenplay lacked cohesiveness.
I loved it.  Wes Anderson is sorta' different, and requires a little patience to get used to.  Take that time.
This film will live up to your expectations. It's a pre-teen love story but has all the usual quirks associated with his films.

Watched this with family, and among the six people watching, none of the group liked this movie.

We watched for 30 minutes, only because the reviews were so good. We would have watched it for 10 minutes before turning it off had the reviews been honest.

This movie is very slow, the plot isn't coherent and headlining actors have very minor roles. I'd consider them cameos really.

This review will probably be down voted into oblivion, although I felt compelled to write this since the movie was so bad. I rarely or never write reviews.
I am tired of buying movies and not watching half of it.  Movie was awful and stupid,2nd time in one week.

Great actors, wonderful production great story. Very funny. Loved this movie from the beginning to the end.  Wes Craven has had some trouble putting his whole view togwther,  in this production the story is simple which helps add to the character development.  There is a reason a list actors signed up for this project.

I was hesitant to watch this movie because, to be honest, it seemed kiddish and I thought it might lack depth. Fortunately, I was wrong in my assumption and I enjoyed watching it. For the current rental price of $.99, I would recommend giving it a watch. If you like movies like Juno and other indie-type of films you should love this one as well. Enjoy!

I gave it five stars because I loved every character, loved the costumes and loved the set details. The two leads never raise their voices above a monotone, yet they have so much youthful emotion welling upside that their behaviour is essentially bezerk wrapped in reasonable. The are adorable together, yet you struggle to decide whether how well you would have accepted them as one of their 12-year-old peers.

Some of the adults are very reserved like these lead children, while others of the adults are essentially the opposite, letting emotions completely run amok while they try to corral the behaviour of the adolescent scouts.

The 1965 vibe is great. Being born in the 1970s, my feelings aren't exactly nostalgia, but I feel like I'm watching a dramatization of the old family photo albums I flipped through as a kid. The costumes are so much fun, ie: the foster father who has a phone to match his house which matches his pants. It seems like everything in this world is tinted with the green, brown and orange hues all those old photos have.

We enjoy a lot of movies because they are about huge disasters or massive criminal plots -- big stuff. I would argue that the transition into adolescence is about as big as it gets for most of us, and certainly something that I can identify with. I really liked this film and would recommend it to most people.

I think it suits certain tastes. My wife thought it was fine, but she knew that it was the sort of thing that I love -- a character story chock-full of quirky people and quotable dialogue.

My wife picked out this movie on amazon on demand (I wanted to Expendibles 2) and I figured I would watch a few minutes than read a book while she finished it.  I ended up watching the whole thing and to my dismay I enjoyed it.  Let me start off if you like Wes Anderson movies than you are getting more of the same however it would rank on the bottem of his list.  The movie itself is to lack a better word cute.  It moves at a steady pace, you never laugh out loud but you do smile throughout and at the end you appreciate it for what it is a simple nice movie to pass away a lazy evening at home.

The movie centers around two children aged 12 who choose to run away together on a small island.  For a moment I thought this was going to be an updated Blue Lagoon but that just for a few moments.  Both children have an interesting back story and their desire for one another is amusing.  The strength of the movie is the supporting actors eveyone from the scout master, the scouts, the girls parents (bill murray) and the police officer looking for them (bruce willis) contribute to this movie which is heavy on dialouge but lacks any real action scenes.

I was very surprised that I ended up enjoying this movie but feel strongly that it would make a good date night movie for just about anyone.

We rented this because we love Bruce Willis and several of the other actors in the movie. The mid-sixties period sets the background for this quirky young, love story. The characters' staid lives are suddenly scrambled by a couple of stoic yet star-crossed kids. Outstanding performances come from both the veteran favorites and new youthful actors. This is a fun watch, but I  left wanting a little more in story. I won't spoil it, by telling the ending, but the story buildup leads you to this inevitable conclusion especially as you watch the last of the action scenes unfold with sometimes cartoonish tableau displays.

Overall, this is a fun movie. I hope they do well with the awards ceremonies.
It was okay. kudos to Bruce for going old and dumpy on this. don't understand why the wonderful Frances Dormand took this less than meaty role.

Moonrise Kingdom has become one of my all-time favorite movies.  Quirky, funny, heart-warming and original, I knew I had to own this movie the first time I watched it.  I recommend Moonrise Kingdom to everyone.  Not everyone "gets" it, but those that do, love it with the intensity that I do.

Moonrise Kingdom is a movie where none of the characters begins to come to life, save for a understated performance by Bruce Willis (of all people). The film is set on a small wooded island off the U.S. east coast in the 1960s where a troubled 12-year-old Boy Scout runs away from camp and elopes with a deeply disturbed 12-year-old girl. Various other scouts and assorted adults give chase. Everyone speaks in a stilted way and the children fire off shots of dialogue that are supposed to be clever but instead are just confusing, so rather than watching the movie (which I'll say is beautifully shot) unfold you're scratching your head and saying "What did that mean?" The adults tend to show off too and come out with lines that make no sense. The fundamental problem is that Moonrise Kingdom can't decide whether it's a romance or a comedy or a satire and veers in and out of each form, making it very hard to follow. Bruce Willis is good, though, as a sad policeman who's rather had the life crushed out of him.

This movie is totally inappropriate for family viewing and puts preteens in a situation that I consider child abuse for the actors.
Our children grow up fast enough. We do not need to suggest innapropriate thoughts to them.
I returned this movie as I cannot support the making of things like this.
This was a Christmas gift for a family member. If there is a defect or something wrong, I will post back a new review.
If you're into a good, "dry" comedy (like many of us are) this movie is for you.  The acting is fantastic, the storyline is original, and the laughs are constant.

I am a total sucker for romantic comedies about kids, as well as coming-of-age flicks. _Moonrise Kingdom_ is one of the best. Acting is excellent all-around. You never quite know what is going to happen next. As one other reviewer said, it almost seems like it was made by kids. It's fun and takes you back to a time when everything seemed simple. My cynicism falls when I watch this movie.

At the same time, it shows just how powerful and vulnerable humans can be. It will make you cry. There are wonderful, heartfelt conversations between all the characters in _Moonrise Kingdom_.

It's also just plain beautiful. The background music and the scenery (nature shots) are just plain spectacular. It's all mixed in well with a great story. _Moonrise Kingdom_ uses music very well, and it creates the experience.

Summing it up, if you have lost all hope of finding love, _Moonrise Kingdom_ will make you believe again. Never have I rooted harder for a couple than I have rooted for Sam and Suzy.
it was a great movie, there wasn't really anything i didn't like about it.i really enjoyed this film... very well done.
This movie came highly recommended, but I really didn't like it that much.  It's okay but I really didn't see what all the fuss was about.
All my favorite actors in one fun movie. Nice to see something light for a change instead of all the heavy drama in other movies.

I found that this movie just did not live up to the crtics' 94%. I would give it about 60.  Liked the set. I did not care for the acting (or lack of) and was not impressed by all the big named actors.
GREAT movie!!!  I highly recommend it.  The casting is superb and the story is sweet and fresh.  The relationships in this story are complex and unusual.  I will buy this movie.
Chose this film because Wes Anderson is brilliant. I liked the childhood charm it held. It should be captivating to all audiences. I will treasure this film forever.
This is definately a quirky movie. It's a decent story - the kids are really excellent. Don't really get all of the accolades though.

I throughly enjoyed the multiple changes from two dimensional
 to three dimensional - the way the play was staged gave it an
otherworldly effect yet set it in reality. Very entertaining yet very
intellectual.

Slow, long looks, and lots of scenary shots (some are very nice). Its a typical comedy of errors and I'll admit I laughed, a little. But I really don't get Wes Anderson, I saw The Royal Tenenbaums and The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou, in the theaters and swore never to make that mistake again. I watched this on Amazon thankfully. I'm a huge fan of movies and really wish I understood where Wes is coming from! But I can only appreciate bit and pieces, but not the product as a whole.
This movie has fun characters you'll cheer for. Well acted and surprises throughout. Laugh out loud funny.  You'll want to watch it again and again.
Great Movie!  I only wish they had more DVD extras.  But so glad we purchased it - will watch it often.
I found it watchable but it's been a while and I don't feel compelled to throw it into the Blue Ray player
While it had some entertaining moments, it wasn't something I enjoyed.  I like some of the actors, but the plot was slow and predictable.
One of those little sleeper movies that never got attention.  Bruce Willis is amazing as an old man but the kids really steal the show and we laughed all the way through.

Everyone is entitled to their opinion, of course, and my opinion is that if you think this movie is boring, bland and uninteresting, then so are you.

This movie hits it out of the park on so many levels. The characters are quirky and (exceedingly) human and the cinematography is gorgeous and static, letting you enjoy the story and the acting without being distracted by camera tricks. The story and characters speak for themselves. As a period piece, the costuming and set decorating are also spot-on.

This is a film I can enjoy over and over again, along with Little Miss Sunshine, O Brother Where Art Thou, The Princess Bride and maybe the first Adams Family movie. Haha.

I'm looking forward to owning the DVD combo pack.
This film was artful and hilarious.  The cast was was second only to the cinematography. Defintely worth the rental, maybe even purchase for your preseonal collection.

I am glad we rented this movie instead of buying it. I read reviews and was looking forward to a quirky but interesting movie. It was indeed quirky but completely uninteresting. You never care for the characters and I kept hoping one would turn into a zombie. Don't waste your time with this dull senseless pablum.
This was a great movie and while it could be described as "delightfully awkward" it was funny, charming, heartwarming, and action packed all at the same time.

I like those "off the beaten path"type movies. and Moonrise Kingdom fits that bill. I takes place in the early 1960s on a small island that is known for being a summer resort. A 13 year old boy scout and  a 13 year old girl come up missing. it does not take long to figure these two kids have run away together. being on a island they do not have too many places they can hide. both kids are misunderstood, a bit on the eccentric side. neither the boy or girl have other friends. they actually meet a year earlier when the boy was on the island with his boy scout troup{actually they are called by a different name but a lot like boy scouts}and they make arrangements to meet the next summer. a lot of the other character have their own "quirks" this comes together well with fine child and adult actors. a fun movie to watch.

It was perfect. Perfect delivery of dialogue. Perfect story. Perfect effects. At least 20 laugh out loud moments, with a handful of deep belly laughs. Shock, surprise, and true love. Absolutely brilliant.
Quirky and charming, with a beautiful musical score.  Has a wonderful ensemble cast, serious and funny at the same time.

Pure, unmitigated Wes Anderson perfection. This film is an exquisite, worthy companion to Rushmore. Mr. Anderson's grasp of the best and worst aspects of being human, combined with a technical wizardry that is unparalleled, results in a film that leaves you looking at your own life with fresh wonder. At least, it did for me. And that's what I go looking for.

My wife and I were looking for a cute romantic diversion after getting snowed into our house over the weekend and picked this flick after thumbing through the romantic movies section of Amazon's instant streaming service.  I had gotten a glowing recommendation from my brother, who likes things that are a bit more on the independent side of mainstream, so we knew that the movie might be a bit strange.

We were not disappointed.  It was strange, and beautiful, and extremely cute, if occasionally disturbing.  Equal parts dark and uplifting, the cast was superb, the camera work was deliberate, well thought out and occasionally brilliant.  The effects budget was obviously small, which resulted in an emphasis on storytelling that I found refreshing.  For better or worse, it seemed more stage than cinema.  My wife's reaction was "That was great but I'm kinda glad I didn't see it in the theater."

I found the story itself addressed a number of deeper issues, from social justice, to depression, to marital strife, responsibility, parenting and small town life.  It addressed these issues seriously, but often using the viewpoint of a child, though I would be aware that some of the themes may require a good deal of explanation to be understood or appropriate for younger children.

The movie is definitely worth watching as a primer on finding the extraordinary in the ordinary, both in terms of people and places.  Go and enjoy it!

We purchased this based on all of the positive reviews, but found it to be corny, bland and boring.  I wish we could get our money back!
There was potential to bring some tension into the plot, but that never materialized.  The acting wasn't very good, in spite of the great cast.
I can't recommend buying this dvd.
Just a very fun and quirky movie to watch.  Found myself laughing a ton.  Edward Norton's character stole the show.
just good storytelling with a quirky twist....not the same old movie formula.  One of the few movies that I enjoy watching again.

This movie was a delightful surprise! If you like quirky or unique, this movie is it. Kinda reminds me of a more lighthearted Coen Bro.'s movie. Enjoy the dialogue and cinematography, both are strengths here. Loved Bruce Willis' cop role here, a play off of his past roles, I felt. Sit back and enjoy, don't take it too serious, and remember what it was like to be a 12 y/o.
These children are so different--you love the characters who actually appreciate them.  This movie will actually leave you feeling good...highly unusual in theatres these days!
A great movie which my boyfriend and I enjoyed greatly. It was everything I expected from a Wes Anderson film and the acting was supurb.

Wes Anderson is a unique talent but he's running out of narrative ideas.  As usual, his sets, locations, and costumes immerse you in a very specific time and place.  This time, however, the script itself lacks emotional nuances and resonance of this boy and girl that the visual details only partially compensate for.  It's well worth renting but not owning because you absorb it all the first viewing.
You just have to see it the kids were fantastic in this movie. It was a refreshing different movie, a must see
Classic Wes Anderson film.  Style and substance reminds me so much of the Life Aquatic with Steve Zizou.  Romance between the two young children is so true for that age range.
Loved this quirky movie and it's time dated subject.  It was wonderful! it will be part of our dvd library for a long time.

MOONRISE KINGDOM is a totally different sort of film, the sort I don't want to over-analyze. I can, however, say the following: Although a bit slow-moving, it's highly imaginative and has a quietly slapstick, satirical humor that's just all its own. Kara Hayward (as Suzy Bishop) and Jared Gilman (as "Sam") are very natural in their roles as two outcast 12-year-olds who find a bond and just want to be alone together, but alas, the world won't let them be. Excellent scenery on "New Penzance," a fictitious New England island without roads that seems to symbolize childhood itself or something like that.

It's one of those films that makes a point of saying "Childhood's real--adulthood's fake." All the same, much of the adult cast, especially Bill Murray as Suzy's crackpot father and Frances McDormand as her tyranncial mother, plays its part very well. MOONRISE KINGDOM also has a great deal of embedded satire regarding bureaucracy in education, paramilitarism in the "Khaki Scouts," dysfunction in the American family, and many other things.

Enjoyed it!

This was a good cast and the camera work was artistically done.  The island is picturesque and feels just like how I imagine life could be like on a small New England island town.  There were some cringe-worthy intimate scenes, but nothing felt gratuitous.  It was an enjoyable, smart piece of story telling - something rare compared to the many mindless action movies out there.
Be warned - this movie is in the vein of other Wes Anderson movies.  It's very quirky and not for everyone.  But if you can get past that, the story is very sweet and funny.
I liked Moonrise Kingdom a lot. It was a goofy and fun movie. The cinematography was really spectacular at times.
If you like quirky.. then go for it... If you like a plot that makes total sense.. stay away.. :)
Right up there with Goonies and Stand By Me for epic childhood movies! Entertaining from start to finish.  Two new stars were born!  Thanks, Wes Anderson!
This is the very first film I viewd on my new KINDLE FIRE. I really thought it was charming & will rent it again in the future
At the time of ordering this video, the price was by far lower than that at either Wal-mart, target, or best buy.  Great movie!
Thanks to a unique story and some strong performaces by Bruce Willis and Ed Norton, this is a movie that will become a classic some day. Everyone over 12 should see it.

Watched this one twice...at home. His movies just don't seem to warrant having to be seen on a big screen because the stories are always intimate and charming but not really cinematic masterworks that rely on a grand visual scale to have impact. It was fun and slightly eccentric like all of his films, but I almost felt like this one was starting to become a little formulaic. It just didn't stick with me like Rushmore or Royal Tennenbaums. Still, I'll eagerly look forward to what comes next and definately make the effort to see it.

A quirky, original and delightful story, with Oscar-winning actors having a wonderful time in their roles.  We have bought this disc for other family members because we wanted to share the discovery of a such an enjoyable entertainment.
awesome movie and came in awesome condition for being a used movie! one of my favorite movies this year woo
A stellar cast, and two of the most adorably awkward, dorky, mis-fit 12 year olds ever destined to rule the world.
This movie just dragged on. I couldn't wait for it to end so I could get on with my life. I do not recommend you waste your time on this movie.

This movie seemed very strange when I started watching it. I'm normally an action movie person myself, but I like the occasional different movie so I watched this. I have to say I loved it. I loved the storyline. I loved the characters. I loved the cinematography. I loved the actors. Overall this was a great movie to me and after you are finished watching the movie you start to like it more and more when you think about it. So give it a try!
This was a gift to my son for Christmas, per his request.  We watched it 2 times in a few days!  Great feel good movie.  Son was very happy.

I happen to love Wes Anderson movies and this was no excpetion! Saw it in the theater and knew I wanted to own the DVD when it was available. Fun story and good characters. Probably doesn't rank as high as some of his other movies but still very good.
I wouldn't wish this trash on anyone. It was not going anywhere, and what we did watch was pure dribble. Don't bother getting it.

Normally I don't write reviews, but more people need to see this film. I could tell within the opening few shots that this would be one of the best films I have seen in decades. This film was obviously made with painstaking attention to detail that gives it a feeling of complete wholeness--there is nothing extraneous or out of place, everything fits and the music wonderfully compliments the action on screen without too pushily telling the viewer how to feel. The big names deliver the caliber of performance you would expect (you can't go wrong marrying Frances McDormand and Bill Murray), but you find yourself surprised by the quality of the child actors and their poignant performances. Moonrise Kingdom is intoxicating in its feeling of storybook-esque nostalgia without becoming cheesy or hackneyed as has unfortunately happened to Tim Burton's work. Perhaps there is something particularly moving about a love story between twelve year olds whose egos haven't yet become confused by the ordeal of adolescence and high school and whose relationship isn't complicated by sex, although the subject certainly is not skirted. Overall, it was wonderful and I could watch it again and again.
Much of the characters' personal struggles are left ambiguous and I found that really refreshing, Moonrise Kingdom never loses focus from the immediate plot for the sake of tragic pasts.
Wonderful true to times epic story line. A throw back to how life once was for our generation. fdgsh gdsgw
I watched this movie with my wife and we both enjoyed it. Her a little more then me but a good movie, well written and has a all star cast in my opinion.
This movie is quirky and fun.  Everything you would expect from Wes Anderson.  I get happy every time I see the previews come on when I'm watching TV.

If your a fan of Wes Anderson then I suggest that you go out and buy this movie right now. Now I do like some of his movies like, Darjeeling Limited, Mr. Fox and The Life Aquatic. This by far is one of his better films. Very original movie with great acting and dialogue throughout the whole movie. I highly recommend this.
Judging by the superstar cast, nobody.  Bill Murray, Frances McDormand, Ed Norton, Harvey Keitel.  Quirky storytelling.  Great characters.  Loved it.

Good actors playing silly characters, thought they should have known better.  Maybe this is just one of the esoteric movies, and I just didn't get it.  What was the plot?  What was the moral?  I didn't get it.

This movie is entertaining the whole way through with an adorable love story of two children and one of a kind characters. If you like Wes Anderson's movies (The Life Aquatic, The Royal Tenenbaums) this will be right up your alley, and if you don't you should still see it because its a movie everyone can enjoy!
I can't believe this received good reviews.  It was a bad movie that only a New York reviewer would love.
This was one of the quirkiest movies I've ever seen.  Well acted, beautifully shot and sweet story. I recommend it. You'll Enjoy!

bit quirky bit a funny and good movie
watched with my teenage daughters & they seemed to like it
Good movie.
Amazing cast.  Beautifully framed and filmed, like all of Andersen's films.  Have seen it twice and will probably watch again.
Great cast and a fun little story.  Very much an independent film.  Not for kids, though.  If you liked Little Miss Sunshine, you'll like this one.
Such a gentle movie set in more innocent times -- no 'techie' stuff.  Two young 'misfits' find each other and go adventuring.
So many people had  recommended this film to me and I was not disappointed. Quirky, funny,sweet, warm and wonderful entertainment.

I'm a big fan of Wes Anderson, the director and creator of "The Royal Tenenbaums" "Rushmore" "Bottle Rockets"... but I don't automatically love every one of his movies. Moonrise Kingdom is one of his best. I highly recommend it.

People often complain that Wes Anderson films are too pretentious. While that may be true, Moonrise Kingdom doesn't suffer from it. The movie, about the naivety, adventurousness and rebelliousness of children, is something that many can relate to. It has a beating heart that sets it apart from his other films. As usual, his cast of characters are odd and quirky, but ultimately endearing. The child actors are perfectly cast and do a wonderful job. This is a movie that I can watch again and again and never get bored.
Eye-candy of a movie, with a sweet storyline. Loved the way the movie was framed and shot, and the actors and script fit perfectly. I would recommend this movie to anyone.

Awesome set design, funny costumes, beautiful soundtrack, nice key turns from solid actors like Bill Murray...the only thing missing is a screenplay and direction that makes you give a damn about the story and people in it.

I loved it. Great acting and a witty script really make this film worth a watch. Too bad it wasn't nominated for Best Picture at the Oscars, but I suppose it may not have been worthy of that award anyway. Great film nonetheless, I recommend this to anyone who enjoys quality, clever movies.

This has a great story plus the visuals are beautiful. The editing is perfect. But best of all is the acting - how could you possibly miss with Willis, Murray, McDormand, Swinton, Balaban - but I want to say extra praise for Norton, Schwartzman and the two kids Hedges and Hayward (not a firm). Actually everyone was great. And don't forget Keitel.
Quirkymovie, reminiscent of " The Incredible Mr. Fox". We laughed through the whole movie! Excellent acting, too. I would watch it again and again!

This is very funny---and very quirky---and Very 60's. Willis's role is not anything like the things we usually see him in. The kids in this are great. A coming of age story. CJ

This is a wonderfully entertaining movie. The actors are superb, the settings are lush and the music is outstanding. We chose this based on the number of stars it had, but before that checked out other reviews online.

I'm not a Wes Anderson fan, but I don't especially dislike him. The only other of his movies I've seen is The Royal Tenenbaums, and I didn't much like it but don't much remember it either. So I enjoyed this movie more than I expected to.

It's quirky and sort of dark, which I like, and it has a consistent tone of unreality all the way through, which I also like. I'd gotten the idea that the Wilson brothers (Owen, et al) are closely bound up with Anderson, so I was relieved not to see any of them here because I can't stand any of them.

But I didn't mind some actors whom I usually can't stand (Tilda Swinton and Bill Murray), I liked one I always like (Frances McDormand), and I was indifferent to the rest, to whom I'm generally indifferent (Bruce Willis, Harvey Keitel, Edward Norton, Jason Schwartzman, etc). The kids were okay but nothing exceptional.

I don't see what in this movie freaked out the people who were freaked out by it, unless it was the sex play between the kids; but heterosexual sex always disgusts me so this was no different. Overall, a movie I enjoyed more than I expected to but probably won't ever watch again.

A very quirky sort of film with a consistent eclectic style all its own. Edward Norton as the OCD Boy Scout Instructor is fun to watch as are the two young leads in the film who share a "young love" story quite unlike anything we've seen onscreen in the past. Visually the film is as unique as its direction and story-line. The film is peppered with nerds, bullies and other interesting youngsters and Bill Murray is particularly amusing in his role as Frances McDormand's wife and co-counsel, as they are both knowledgeable, yet "not quite right" lawyers. As I said, this film has plenty of style and a lot of warmth, too. It's exceedingly watchable and a good family movie for a rainy Saturday afternoon. Totally a Wes Anderson film from start to finish!

Ah, the joys of adolescence.  You are hounded by your parents, chastised by your peers and scorned by your first love.  You are misunderstood, underappreciated and overprotected and at the end of the day, your life is just now starting to `begin' and you have a whole lot of life left to live, so you better get used to it now!

I don't know why I'm drawn to movies about childhood, but I certainly am.  Maybe it's the fact that it is a part of my life I often reflect on, or maybe it is because I can see it starting to form in the eyes of my children, but the bottom line is that these films truly impress something upon me, truly speak to the core of me.  Like Jonze did in a more fantastical way, and Zietlin did in a more earthy way, Anderson proves that he understands the misunderstood in a more humorous and charming way.

Yes, Wes Anderson understands what it means to be a child.

I'm a fan of Wes.  I'm not a rabid fan.  I don't bow down at the altar of Wes Anderson.  I thought `Rushmore' was uneven and `The Life Aquatic' slightly vacant, but `Fantastic Mr. Fox' was fantastic (pun intended) and `The Royal Tenenbaums' is one of the best comedies of the past decade.  For me, `Moonrise Kingdom' is his finest film and, without question, a masterpiece!  A beautifully intricate screenplay (so much subtle depth), a brilliant ensemble (Willis!  Norton!  Swinton!), not to mention two leads that truly understood the balance needed to sell all aspects of their situation.  Gilman and Hayward were outstanding to say the least, full of such adolescent truth and wonderment mixed with the sparks of individuality that make themselves prevalent at that ripe age of change.  Mix in with that Anderson's keen use of visuals (the sets, the costumes) and the beautiful score and you have a pitch perfect film from start to finish.

What makes `Moonrise Kingdom' so insightful is the subtle way in which Anderson is able to bleed his themes into all aspects of his film.  When you consider the core story regarding Sam and his relationship with Suzy (the birth of adolescence through the pangs of first love) and then you see that same central theme trickle into the depiction of the adults around him, whether they be the lonely Captain Sharp (a magnificent Bruce Willis) or the repressed Laura Bishop (McDormand) or the childlike innocence of Scout Master Ward (a beautifully toned turn from Edward Norton), Anderson took the time to develop so much substance behind every conversation.  There is so much to glean from the development of story here that it demands repeat viewings.

The key being that this film is wonderful enough to deserve them!

And that is certainly key here as well.  Wes Anderson has a distinct style of filmmaking.  He is clever and witty and possesses a charm that makes his films rest warmly on the palate.  Using his sharp sense of direction, Anderson creates such a welcoming format for his tale.  He has perfected his approach and delivered a film that is tonally perfect, one that pulls us in and holds us close and urges us to keep watching with gentle prods that assure us, like a parent does a child, that we truly want to see how this story unfolds.
Thought the movie was pretty boring. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who is looking to be entertained. I turned it off with 45 minutes left.
The plot was confusing and very slow to build.  If a movie doesn't hook me right away, you've lost me.  I guess the acting was okay, but again it was an odd plot with odd characters.
Great movie start to finish. If you've enjoyed any of Wes Anderson's previous films, then Moonrise Kingdom is a must see.
Fantastic movie with a great star studded roster. The kids were wonderful and they are definetly the stars of the movie. Lighthearted and fun. Will definetly watch again.

The video quality was so poor I couldn't stand to watch it. Way out of focus. The film wasn't compelling enough for me to want to get  past the poor quality, so I can't really review the film in a fair way.

Beautiful, funny, touching, exquisitely well done.  Amazing cast- Bill Murray and Frances McDormand especially.  I always love Wes Anderson's movies, Royal Tenenbaums particularly.  This is another fine example of his work- wonderful characters, impeccable sets.  It is as if each shot is a piece of art.  It is incredible to me.  Writing this is making me in the mood to watch it again.
A child hood fantasy, a world of wonderful memories, a beautiful aesthetic and a very simple complicated story, believably told through the eyes of children, thus is a delightful little movie :)

Who is Wes Anderson's Art Director?

I knew from the first frame I would love this film.  Composition, quirkiness, underlying genius, all of Anderson's trademarks embodied long before the first word of dialogue.  Gotta love this man, he is a unique voice, an impeccable filmmaker.

Honoring his first actors/devotees/stars, Bill Murray and Jason Schwartzman join in the fun, adding offbeat panache in colors only they, unique craftsmen, could muster.  And nothing quells a brief rush of joy when Francis McDormand sneaks onto screen as a militant mother who shamelessly smokes indoors and wrangles her brood using a megaphone--there is no doubt she will turn in a layered, thoughtful study.  With Bruce Willis headlining, Tilda Swinton and Ed Norton round out the all-star ensemble supporting two child-star leads (Jared Gilman and Kara Hayward) and their story of pre-pubescent, town-rattling, romance.  Innocent, mostly, as adventurous, this is not to be confused with a children's movie.  Adult themes outweigh what's childlike, even as kids out-number adults 5 to 1 in this flick.  Think 48 Hours Missing Persons meets Teletubbies, and you're getting close to where Moonrise Kingdom's rating should be.

For the rest of us, especially the "well over 18" crew, Moonrise is rare cinema candy with great performances, welcomed simplicity and trademark Anderson uber-creative strokes.

Gerald Sullivan, by the way, is the Art Director here.  And his work here is Oscar-worthy.
2 hours of my life ill never get back. Nobody like able with little humor and gratuitous violence against animals
Utterly charming!  A movie experience with terrific acting, wonderful ambiance, beautiful scenes, and unusual presence-- it will leave you smiling.

This was a stunning accomplishment. It was as if I was transported back in time to my childhood. Everything looked 'right'. The film, the props, the outfits - everything. Not only that, the acting was great and balanced, the story was engaging light hearted and innocent - with just enough of a dose of reality to make it not feel too surreal. Great accomplishment. I'll likley do something with this movie I seldom do - watch it again soon!
Just awful.  Boring, dull, poorly done.  Hard to say anything good about this film.  I couldn't survive more than the first 20 minutes before I had to turn it off.

I hadn't heard of the movie until I saw clips from it on the Golden Globes Awards.  I rented the movie and was pleasantly surprised.  The cast was excellent, and the story was cleverly written, and turned into a very charming film. For me, when I watch a movie two or three times I know it's good.
Enjoyed all the layers of the film, as well as the cast of actors made it that much more enjoyable. A Light very heart warming feel good movie

You should know by now what you're getting into when you check out a Wes Anderson movie. Oddball characters, all with the same artsy monotone adult voice (even the kids) that find themselves in silly situations. I rank this above Steve Zissou, but it's WAY below Royal Tenenbaums and Rushmore, as far as comedy goes. Don't expect too much from Bill Murray in this one. He's barely in the movie at all. The real star is Ed Norton as the scout master. It is a sweet movie about young romance and how you can find love even if you're a troubled weird-o.

Cute movie - cute story, cute characters. Darn, can't believe an old f....... like me saying this. See it, think you'll agree - cute!
really enjoyed seeing this and didn't have to wait long to watch, the disc came within a few days and played great! i appreciate it!

Although I typically love Wes Anderson, and there was a lot of big name actors in this movie - I felt they weren't really challenged or really being utilized to their fullest ability. It was still entertaining, but I felt it was missing that 'umph!'.
I loved this movie even while watching it shoved into the front row, very last seat on the left of the theater.  I knew I had to see it again in a different venue & wonderful!

I have to say I am a huge fan of all wes anderson's films; his style of story-telling is unique. "Moonrise Kingdom" has all the usual ingredients, excellent cinematography, witty dialogue, mark mothersbaugh's amazing music choices, a great story and a phenomenal cast. this is a must see film. buy it now.

The first moments grab and hold. The year doesn't matter. We've all been there at one time or another and it finally feels good and makes sense. Pure joy including the final credits. Recommended for all ages--including snobs and bullys.
A really fun, but different movie with a lot of familiar faces!  The kids are great (& so is Bruce Willis!).
This is a fantastic film! It is quirky and original and dare I say "cute." It has definitely earned its nominations for all the award shows. Amazing writing.
Got this on recomendation from a friend. Different kind of movie. Good to see big name actors doing different kinds of movies. But you do have to be in the proper mood to appreciate it.

I rented this on a whim, not having heard anything about the movie. What a fabulous surprise. The film is a gem in its unique quirkiness. You wonder, who came up with this story? You find yourself getting really invested in the various (all interesting) characters. Every single person in the movie is portrayed perfectly by their respective actors.

In particular, I loved the art direction and photography, both of which sustain a 60's feel throughout the entire film. It was a delight to watch. My personal favorite was Tilda Swinton as Social Services. What a riot.

If you like movies that are not predictable and take you on a ride you may not expect, watch Moonrise Kingdom.
Beautifully shot, lovely music, great acting.  If you like quirky comedies with one-line zingers, this is a great movie for you.

Cute and original fable about preteen boy and girl who fall in love and run away together in 1965 New England, causing the adults in the entire region to get their knickers in a twist and  propose electroshock therapy.
As with any other movie, it's a subjective thing.  If you enjoy the Napoleon Dynamite-type of show, you may well enjoy this one too.

I think this movie might have been overrated. Maybe my expectations were too high? It was cute and entertaining(ish), but a little slow and long toward the end. I've heard lots of people say it was "the best movie of the year." It wasn't bad, but it did seem to try really hard to be artsy or different or something. Just okay, in my opinion.
OK. A nice watch, bit unconventional, but not really sure why it got nominated for an Oscar. Oh, because now they nominate ten &*!@! movies
The movie just had a strange pace to it at times...I guess I should have expected this from a Wes Anderson movie.
my son and I watched it together and I'm not sure if the sound of his laughter made me smile more or the movie. Great film!

Is it any good?

If you have seen a Wes Anderson film, you will know what to expect. The wide angles, the centre framing, the Bill Murray's. They are all here. It's a love story about some runaway kids; sure, maybe not everyone's cup of tea, but you cannot help but be swept up by the nostalgia of 60's. Simpler times, where kids were either playing outside or listening to the radio. Anderson again pulls together an all star cast, including Murray of course, but also featuring the likes of Bruce Willis, and Edward Norton as the Scout Master desperately searching for his member before a violent storm engulfs the island. This cute and quirky film will defiantly appease Wes Anderson fans, but may also be appreciated but those who have yet to experience his genius.

Best bit?

Sam and Suzy set up camp on the Cove, kind of like lord of the flies, but with less murders and more romance.

Did you know?

The film currently has a 98% positive review rating by the top critics on Rotten Tomatoes.
Very funny movie; dark comedy.  The cast was perfect for the story  I laughed out loud. I recommend this movie.
Funny story line, filmed in a beautiful location, the director could have edited out all the swearing words, I recommended it.

At the surface level, "Moonrise Kingdom" is a simple story of puppy love.  But there is far, far more going on beneath the surface.  The two puppy lovers are both troubled youths, and it is only through the inattentions and inactions of all the adults around them that they are able to create, ultimately, a life-or-death crisis.  To what extent are the kids responsible for their perceived failings?  Moonrise Kingdom presents a compelling case that the kids are alright and it is the adults who are screwed up.

The stars of Moonrise Kingdom are the two twelve year-old lovers, portrayed by child actors Jared Gilman and Kara Hayward.  Both do a more-than-credible job, and will have you rooting for them to succeed on their attempted escape.  The main adult roles fall to Bruce Willis and Edward Norton, who turn in fine performances of somewhat stereotyped characters: the sleepy town police chief, and the by-the-book scoutmaster.  The roles of Bill Murray and Frances McDormand are not significant enough to showcase the talents of those two accomplished actors.

The movie takes place in director Wes Anderson's picture postcard-perfect alternate universe, a visually striking place in which everything (even including kids' play areas) is perfectly ordered and ready to be photographed.  Even Kara Hayward's 12 year-old runaway girl somehow maintains her neatly applied eye shadow during the course of a multi-day outdoor excursion.  Similarly, all of the characters aside from the two lovers are simplified stereotypes: the government bureaucrat, the bully, the loyal dog, even the narrator with perfect diction.  Yet Moonrise Kingdom not only works, but it delivers some deep messages in a touching, humorous way that will capture the hearts of most audience members.

Definitely recommended, for adults and families with older children.

Only Wes Anderson could weave together such a seamless tapestry of wonder, imagination and creative twists and turns. The narrative is illustrated masterfully with myriad compelling visual and psychological elements. I kept flashing back to Fantastic Mr. Fox as the story unfolded (another Wes Anderson favorite). The cast and direction were flawless. A true creative masterpiece!
This DVD is an edited version of the movie shown at the movie theater.  There are scenes which have been eliminated which is not desirable.
Just an odd, quirky movie. I rented it to see where it was filmed in Rhode Island, but I didn't recognize a lot of the areas.

The story of two young teens running away from life and drawing together in a puppy love type affair. One runs away from family, the other from a scouting encampment. Top notch cast, script, and acting. Very artistic camera work with tremendous attention paid to every detail in every shot, even the stuff in the background. The film is highly yellow tinted for emotional effect. Probably not suited for viewing by pre-teens for promoting running away, dancing in public in underwear, and lots of smoking.
This film would have been much better without the constant smoking promotions as product placement through out the entire film. Perhaps a good idea to teach your kids how product placements in movies work so they can grow up to be aware of them. I think this was one of the best movies of 2012.

I wanted to see this in the movie theater, but missed it. I am glad I only paid 3.99 for the rental. This movie was slow and boring. I couldn't even get through it in the 4 hours I was on the plane. It was awful, I don't recommend it.
The actors were spot on in these wildly unconventional roles.  The plot was unbelievable and let you fill in the blanks.  Both my husband and I loved it and have seen it twice.

Of the alternate worlds in Wes Anderson's brain that he so generously shares with us. Perhaps not as jarring or worldly as his previous works, this film will stand the test of time as a classic Anderson flick.

I'm sorry I rented this movie, if you can call it that. I've rented or watched films by this director a number of times and have found them to be weird/bizarre/stupid/pointless and poorly scripted and/or acted. Never again will I waste my time on such a movie.
This was a sleeper of a movie at the theaters but my family loved it.  It was quirky but the acting was terrific!
I thought the plot was very novel and witty. I hesitate to call the film cute, but the characters were adorably precocious.
Found it rather boring.  Kids spoken word was a little garbled and low. Very strange content and characters, not my style.

Moonrise Kingdom got great reviews and was favorably compared with "Fargo."  Well, it's no "Fargo".  The scriptwriter seems to have borrowed the technique of stilted dialog and quirky characters from "Fargo" but someone forgot that the audience has to care about the characters.  The single biggest flaw  of this film is the casting of the male lead, Sam, played by Jared Gilman. Sadly, this kid has no charisma.  How he made it through the screen test is a complete mystery; they could have probably dragged some random kid out of any 5th grade class in America and gotten someone more appealing.  It's hard to "care" what happens to him. In fact, he's close to unlikeable.  And so, there is a hole at the heart of the movie, for which all the other excellent actors--who do a good job with their roles--just can't compensate.  The second biggest flaw is the casting of his supposedly pre-teen love interest, who seems to have some sort of never-explained mood disorder. Once again, a little back-story might have helped, as would the casting of someone who looks and acts closer to age 11/12 than 17.  I might also say that whoever wrote the dialog for these kids apparently hasn't talked to a preadolescent in a looooong time.  Here's a clue:  kids don't talk like Wikipedia and if they do, it turns everyone else off.  There is a sort of semi-sex scene with these two kids late in the movie which as a pediatrician and child psychiatrist made my skin crawl.  It was unnecessary and gratuitous and frankly creepy.  As I write this, I am still baffled by the rave reviews.  I have to stretch to give it even 2 stars.

I normally have a no-movie-buying policy.  I love movies, but I don't need physical copies of them cluttering up the house.  Downloads are too easily available, without any storage issues.  But in this case, my son fell in love with this movie in the theater, and I loved that this is the first movie he truly loved.  So this was a Christmas gift, and a much appreciated one.  The fact that I broke the house rule for it made the gift doubly sweet.  Kind of like the treat of getting to stay up past your bedtime (reason alone to have a strict bedtime).

I love all of Wes Anderson's films, but this was particularly good. The characters are so endearing. The acting was wonderful. It was funny and touching and sweet. The story is great! And I loved the cinematography and music as well. If you like Wes Anderson, you'll love this.
This movie was great. The style was retro and offbeat and it was really well done. I would recommend it for sure :)

This may be Wes Anderson's best film yet. The action centers around two preteens who run away from home. Even though we know a bittersweet ending is coming, we can't help but root for Sam and Suzy as they escape from Sam's looming commitment to an orphanage and Suzy's dysfunctional family. They stave off the ambiguities and compromises of adulthood for a couple of days (if Suzy's parents are what adults are like, count me out), but we know they can't hold out forever. Somehow it all works out through the magic of Wes Anderson.

A great movie for anybody who remembers wondering if becoming a grownup is worth the trouble, especially those on the other side of adolescence who still aren't sure.

One wonders what would pulll Bill Murray out of his self inposed exile, combine him with a very tongue in cheek Bruce Willis and Frances McDormond and we find it here. Wes Anderson makes odd, but compelling movies that appeal not only to adults but to young adults and children. It's a shame his movies don't do better in theaters but don't miss a chance to watch this wonderful, coming of age movie.
Watched this movie with relatives over the holidays, enjoyed it very much and recommend it very highly to everyone who likes a great quirky film!

Wes Anderson's still crankin out the good stuff.  By this point, you love him or hate him, let's face it.  Those that like Wes at ALL will love this movie - it's one of his best, in my opinion.  Well-scripted, acted, and shot, I thought it was a great addition to his growing body of quirky, heartfelt, humorous movies.

The story is unusual with delightful characters whose outlook on life does not in any way meet the normal standard. Both of the young people live their lives in a manner that  adheres to their own standards. In doing so, they create an atmosphere of good cheer and good sense. The rest of the characters are unable to come to grips with those so far out of the mainstream, and are to be pitied rather than admired. It is a genuine good feeling story.
Loved all the actors. could relate to the time. Boy Scout Camp awesome. Loved the schoolhouse effect of the home. Very unique in every way. Will watch again.
My husband and I watched this on Christmas Eve after all the presents were set up and under the tree.  It is so great- the music is amazing, and the story is just so endearing.  Highly recommend it!

Wes Anderson movies are like eating only cake for dinner. The first piece is delightful. The second piece is good. The third piece is really just too much. By the final piece you think "now why did I like that first piece so much?"
Quirkily magnificent.  Definitely worth a watch.  a a a a a a a a a a a a a h!

If you like Wes Anderson movies, you will like this. When I first saw it I didn't know it was Wes Anderson but I recognized the style immediately. It has well-known actors who play out the story in a compelling and comedic fashion. It's a fun, light-hearted film that still manages a subtle focus on interesting and controversial topics.

i think this movie is fabulous! if you liked 'stand by me', you'll like this one too. great story, great ending! full of twists and surprises!  Set back in the 60s, it's a terrific visit to times gone by, but a timeless story.
This movie DVD purchase was a gift for my sister-in-law. I'm told she loves the movie, so I am giving it 5 stars!

despite the christmas rush, this product was sent to me on time and in great condition.  thanks for taking such great care. this was a present and they loved it! thanks again! would highly reccommend.
Fabulous quirky movie.  Watched with my love and we really enjoyed it.  It made for a greate movie night at home.
Really enjoyed the movie.  Fun story and good acting.  Quite a few major actors in downplayed roles. Would recommend viewing.
Moonrise Kingdom is a great Movie. Great Cast. Awesome story telling by Wes Anderson. A must have for a movie collection.

I have no idea how many times I have watched this movie, but I like it more and more each time. The characters are very human to the point of being humorous but then at moments it becomes deeply touching and relateable.

If you've seen any Wes Anderson movies before, this is the epitome of his quirkiness. It might be too much for some people, but it's also a really fun movie. With it came a free amazon instant rental of the movie (for streaming). This was only active for a certain time after the purchase (maybe a month, but I forget). I didn't really care for that, and didn't think I would use it. However, a few days later with some friends it turned out to be a perfect way to watch the movie! The streaming worked great, and the idea of giving out a temporary free digital rental is a great one.
Worst movie I remember watching. Waste of time and money.  I'd give it a  zero if I could.  Wish I had my money back.
Love the cast, the locale, the story, the quirky family and the memories of what it is like to be young and wanting to be somewhere else other than where you are.
A funky little movie.  E. Norton was great.  Some of the content was a little strange due to the age of the kids.
Can't wait to watch it again!  Great cast and lovable characters kept me interested all the way through the movie!
I'm still confused about the rave reviews for this movie. I thought it was very strange, to say the least.

Hilarious! This movie is great! It made me laugh and remember things about being a kid and falling in love for the first time. I found myself so engrossed with the characters and I even laughed out loud! Great Film!!

Loved this movie. Great cast and done very well. Totally captures the grandeur of childhood and first relationships. Music is A++ as well. All typical for a Wes Anderson film. If you liked Royal Tenenbaums, then you would love this film.
It's a good original story that adds something new to films in general with funny and unusual characters. It has a refreshing complexity.
Quirky; weird at the beginning then gets funnier from there.  Wish more movies like this were made.  Must rent not own.
