This movie was so meticulously and beautifully shot. All of the little details of a Wes Anderson film that make them so great were preserved for me to revel in again and again and again...

This is one of Wes Anderson's best films - it's a sweet, innocent fairy tale of a movie.  The stuff with the scouts is great and both lead child actors are amazing.  If you've had a hard time swallowing Wes Anderson's style, then this movie could be the one to make you a fan.

loved this movie--and have seen it 3 times--always something new visually.  plus the story line is very cute, very heartwarming...and tells a great story about human nature and mis-estimating people (for the good or bad).
Wes Anderson has a beautiful fingerprint. His films are always creative, quirky, and touching. Moonrise Kingdom is another example of the wonderful films he makes.

It was entertaining and ok, but just not cohesive enough t be excellent or great.  I look at this as one of those movies that is entertaining but don't expect anything great.  I wouldn't watch it again because it is nothing special.
Worth watching, maybe, maybe not...

This movie was funny and unpredictable as well as visually appealing. It also managed to be more lighthearted than other Wes Anderson films, and the relationships felt more authentic. Be forewarned though; there are a few scenes that young children should not see (a dog is shot and killed accidentally with an arrow, and the 2 pre-teens come very close to having sex)
The director sets this in the time of his childhood, which is a bit before mine, but I still connected with it very easily.  This movie is constantly fun and entertaining.  The cast is phenomenal!
it is one of those movies that critics love and rave about, but most people would find weird and just OK.
A quirky story with some great actors, but the two unknown young actors steal the show! Fun movie set in a great location.
Hilarious movie. Reminded me of the akwardness and seemingly serious nature I took everything as a youth. Loved Bill Murray and Ed Norton. 5 stars
My wife and I loved this movie.  Great story, acting, and music.  We only rented it, but plan to buy!

I guess the producers wanted an arts-fartsy movie but this bordered on child pornography. It could have easily been a fun movie about children's antics such as Christmas Story, but instead acted out on ADD and other problems we would love to escape from. Not a prude, though I have standards--truth is I was in the middle of the "business" when I lived in S. Cal so I know of what I speak.

Stay away from this and especially keep your children away from it.
I love all of this director's movies! It was a classic Wes Anderson flick so I wasn't let down! I love the story and all the characters and the colorful scenery

This is not a movie that I would watch over and over.  Once was enough.  It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't memorable either.  I was sorry for that because this movie was suppossed to be along the lines of the Roal Tennenbaums, which is one of my favorite movies.  But, I felt the story and acting with this movie just weren't as good.

This will be a cult classic. The cast do a spectacular performance by creating fictitious community that draws you into the lives of coming to age youth's with a  odd tainted love spin. Bruce Willis breaks his tough guy casting with his great performance. Bill Murray is Bill Murray, always a top performance. Entire cast does a great job.

Absolutely loved this move. The all-star cast lives up to their talents.

You DO NOT have to be a Wes Anderson fan to enjoy this movie, this is fun for any and all.
Almost as good as The Royal Tennenbaum's... definitely will be one of our favorite Wes Anderson movies. It is a must see!
great job the movie was great. we watched twice. did great job came when i need it love :-). will order agin

Its a quirky, sort of funy, odbal litle movie that you realy want to be beter than it is. if you really like stuff like "the Full Monty" or "A Fish Called Wanda" then maybe you won't quite be as disapointed as i was. bil muray just walks through his scenes as if he was stil playing the fake zombie in "Zombieland" and the rest of the cast is just too confusing to kep up with.
One of Wes Anderson's best films.  I must admit I am a big fan of this director and this is one of my favorites.

This movie was recommended as entertaining & quirky...I can take some quirkiness, but it was over the top for me.  I did enjoy the 60s look and feel, but I kept waiting to discover the whole point of the movie, which was never really revealed.

I watched this movie because it had a 94% rating from Rotten Tomatoes, which I had never seen for any other movie before.  Let me be very frank here:  this is the type of movie you would expect from some untalented french director who thinks he is an artistic genius.  This movie is not witty, nor funny, nor smart nor are the characters likeable, interesting or quirky.  Moonrise Kingdom is one of the worst movies I have ever seen, primarily because the viewer is acutely aware every minute of the movie that the people behind it were trying hard to create Oscar material.  Moonrise Kingdom is a waste of time and money, and not even Bill Murray can change that.
Saw this in the theater but I was distracted so I missed a lot.  I'm really glad I bought it and watched it again.  Cute and made me laugh too.
Beautifully developed characters and an enjoyable story. And I enjoyed that the reason for the title isn't revealed until the very end.

This was a magical film for children and adults. It takes a little magical thinking to transplant yourself back to adolescence. This story all begins on an island, and no one else seems to live there but the people involved. Suzy, played by Kara Howard lives with her family on this island. She seems to be the 'difficult' one in the family. On the same island is a Boy Scout camp, where Sam, played by Jared Gilman, an orphan, also seems to be the odd man out. No one seems to like him, and strangely he and Suzy met last summer and have planned a rendezvous to run away together. This sets the wheels in motion for an adolescence hunt by some very strange people. Bill Murray plays Suzy's father, and Frances McDormand plays her mother. Any film with McDormand amd Murray is sure to be a great one. We also have Bruce Willis playing the Island Policeman, Scoutman Ward payed by Ed Norton, and SocialServices played by Tilda Swinton. All these characters lead to an often time humorous film that deals with the turmoil of adolescence, the goodness of scouting, and the trials and tribulations of life. This film is all played with straight faces, none for laughs, and the children are as superb as the adults. Wes Anderson has put together a film for us all, shining examples of life as we remember it. Recommended. prisrob 01-05-13 Scrooged Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day

Some critics have seemed to fallen in love with this quirky indy film.  I am not one of them.  Despite the presence of several top notch actors - Bruce Willis, Bill Murray, Edward Norton, Frances McDormand, and others, its quirkiness is so over-the-top that it never rings true.  There is not a single character in the movie that acts in a realistic manner.  One could argue that since, after all, it is meant to be a fantasy film it need not be realistic, but any fantasy film still needs some grounding in some semblance of reality.

I found the relationship between the two lead children, which some have characterized as whimsically innocent, to be only creepy.  What is their mutual attraction based on, simply that they both are weirdo outcasts?  There appears to be a sexual element which seems hardly innocent in two preadolescents.  The adult characters are all strange ducks - but not in any cute cuddly way - they all seem capable of being ax murderers in their lives off-screen (except for the Bruce Willis character).

Finally, the characterization of the Boy Scouts in this film is so exaggerated, so stereotypically negative (whose leaders seem either Nazi control freaks or potential pedophiles) that it loses any sense of credibility.

Critics seem to love indy director Wes Anderson, I find his quirkiness only annoying - witness Rushmore, The Royal Tenenabaums, and my most un-favorite, The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou.  Give the Bottle Rocket formula a rest Wes!

With the star studded cast, i had much higher hopes for this movie. The story is good, but it just feels like something was missing. With hind sight, i would've waited till this movie was discounted or available on prime.
It's a movie for children and young teens.  It's so corny that you can hear the corn popping.  Plot is implausible, characters are cute but unconvincing.

Don't know why this is so highly rated. Yeah, the child actors did great but Bruce Willis and Ed Norton?  Weird, disturbed characters that added nothing to their previously stellar resumes.  I'm sick of "sweet stories of teenage angst and love" that make it ok to run away from home and engage in pubescent intimacy and authorize adultry. Academy Award potential? You've got to be kidding!
Saw this movie in the theater and had to have it. Great cast who work well with the script and each other.

I rank this film in my top 10 of 2012 for multiple reasons. Most importantly, it's the characters that drive the film and are continually engaging to watch. If you enjoyed Royal Tannenbaums or The LIfe Aquatic, then you will most definitely enjoy this film. Highly recommend.

I like anything by Steve Tyrell - wish he made more cd's.  Also, like all the American Songbook cd's by Rod Stewart.  The Christmas cd got bad reviews in the paper, but I liked it.  As for Moonrise Kingdom - my son recommended it, and I thought it was just kooky.  Saw in today's paper it's up for an award for I think original screenplay.  Just my opinion!

quite entertaining though the camera work and slow scene progression required a little more work than I like when I watch what I thought would be a light entertaining movie, still worth watching though, maybe watching it a second time would permit me to appreciate the producer's intentions better

A great and quirky movie that captures the innocence of youth, Scouting, conflict and conforming....lots of known actors in unconventional roles...

Will watch it again!
I knew nothing about this movie when I discovered it poking around on Amazon's site. It was a very pleasant surprise! Fun, poignant and very artful. Both my wife and I loved it.

A funny, poignant film centering around two bright, independent and eccentric preteens. Their worlds are seemingly very different and they are being parented by dysfunctional adults who seem to have tunnel vision. These adults are misguided daily by their own baggage and have little energy left for their families. Only the offbeat camp leader seems to have a clue. When these preteens befriend each other and fall in love, we see just how desperate they are for love, understanding, and normalcy. A very funny, feel-good movie!
We watched this movie when we were trying out the Amazon Prime trial service. It was quirky and interesting. The average Netflix  rating is 3.6 I would give it a 3. Entertaining but not memorable...
This movie surprised me. I loved the theme of "worn tired love" pitted against "fresh first love". It was sad, funny, and entertaining. I recommend it!

good movie, i enjoyed it, something different.
all the characters did a good job.
I will watch it again soon
With limited options, I decided to give Monrise Kingdom a shot. It turned out to be an a, cool, quirky, enjoyable film. Worth renting.
Wes Anderson has done it again! If you like his movies, you will love this one. I wish I could give this review six stars

Wes Anderson does a great job of elevating this movie to the level of art as he makes strong use of color and music to bolster his major themes. Additionally,  the story and acting contained in this movie are superb thanks to excellent casting and writing. I purchased this on amazon as a digital copy stored in the cloud and that had led to some buyer's remorse as I didn't notice that the amazon instant video service is limited to select devices (unfortunately my phone is not one such device).  Overall I'm happy to own this film and am sure I will will enjoy it again and again on devices other than my phone.
This is an interesting and entertaining movie. I don't like very many movies, but this one kept me interested and involved.

I really like this guy's films. He's fresh and the subject matter is great. Bill Murray doesn't make many films anymore but I see he likes Anderson's work too. Great sets, costumes, music, dialog and acting. I think it should win an Academy Award. Keep em' coming Dude.

Sure, it's capital Q Quirky.  And I hope they paid Bob Balaban extra for wearing that ridiculous gnome outfit.  But if you let yourself into the universe of this movie, it's worth it.  Maybe it doesn't quite touch the heights of all time masterpieces of whimsy like "Local Hero" and "Big Deal on Madonna Street," but just the brilliant pairing of Benjamin Britten boy's choir music with the poetic goof of the imagery alone would make this film soar above average indie fare.  Alexander Desplat's score strikes the right notes, too, holding its own alongside Britten, Schubert, and Saint Saens.

But at the core are the characters, and I bought the intense and weird love story around which everything else winds.  Think of this as Blue Lagoon starring the cast of "The Munsters," "Fargo,"  and "Edward Scissorhands," and you'll have the idea.  Add the overall aura of enchantment, and you have something as charming as the French music on the soundtrack.

One of a kind-- and a brilliant gem.
This is definitely my favorite movie to come out in 2012 - and quite possibly my favorite Wes Anderson movie yet. MUST OWN.

MOONRISE KINGDOM is the latest, quirky movie by Wes Anderson.  Fans will love the story of childhood love set on a New England island called New Penzance in 1965. Sam and Suzy are 12-year olds who meet one summer. They write throughout the year and make a pact to sneak off together the next summer. Sam abandons his scout troop, and Suzy leaves her parents. The two kids meet up and share an innocent love while the entire island is looking for them.

I've enjoyed all the Wes Anderson movies I've watched (only missed one), but I'm not an ardent fan or defender. His casts are always top notch, and this film includes Bruce Willis, Bill Murray, Frances McDormand, Tilda Swinton, Jason Schwartzman, and Edward Norton. Fans of Anderson will find plenty to like in this quirky coming of age story.

Kara Hayward and Jared Gilman steal the show as Sam and Suzy, two young kids who are in love. They share adventure, and a first kiss on a beach they call Moonrise Kingdom. I however, wanted to point out that I believe there is a little too much sexuality in the film concerning a 12 year old girl. I don't deny that it is realistic, or that it works in the movie. While on the beach, the two kids go swimming, stripping down to underwear. Suzy's bra shows tons of cleavage, and one shot basically shoots straight down her bra. Also, she asks the little boy to put his hand on her chest. I felt uncomfortable watching scenes on film that are usually depicted by actors at least 18 years of age.

I went on Amazon affiliated IMDB to see other viewer's thoughts on this, and anyone who was critical of the sexuality in this movie was called every name in the book. I've never seen so much hate in my life. Fans of Anderson have every right to defend this movie. But as someone who considered watching this movie with my 11 and 9 year old kids, I'm sure glad I didn't. I'm writing this review to give a heads up to parents who may feel the same way I do. People may bash this review too, or think I'm a prude or out of touch. Trust me, I'm not. I enjoy sex and romance in a movie just as much as the next guy, I just don't want to see 12 year olds doing it.

although they are saying possibility of an oscar nomination, i don't think it's a "big" enough movie.  but it was sooo good on the big screen, when you could really see the right-on details of the 60s.  great plot, interesting, quirky characters, clever original script, interesting "feel", interesting and beautiful backgrounds. a really good movie, but not for those who want big budget special effects

I really did enjoy this film. What a great cast, although I don't feel that all were used as well as they could have been. Example- Frances McDormand just needed more to work with. Edward Norton was outstanding as the tense and challenged scout leader. I have never been overly impressed by Norton, but he nailed it with this movie role.

The storyline of the movie is amusing, fast moving, sweet, nostalgic, and filled with great sense of the period. It is not hollywood style with the typical unrealistic stretch of sensibility. It tells a story and it tells it well.

I would enjoy watching this movie again! I am still chuckling from it!
Quirky and romantic in a very clean, non-sexual, way. It almost (but only almost) made me miss being a tween.
A love story featuring 12 year olds.  Kinda seemed like it was written by 12 year olds.  Very nice cinematography though, and a fun cast.
I thought this movie would have some interest for me when I rented it. I did not even finish watching it, because it just wasn't my kind of movie.
My husband and I really enjoyed this movie on New Years Day. Great actors set in the mid-60s with fun and quirky twists and turns. Big thumbs up from both of us!
Good movie with interesting characters.  Enjoyed it and the plot.  It is definitely a movie that I can recommend to family and friends.
Everyone needs to view this!  A very un Bruce like movie! I think that they really brought their point across!
I'm not a boy scout, nor was I raised in the 1960s. I did find this an entertaining depiction of both.
Looking for a movie to just entertain you?  This is one of those quirky movies with lots of texture and great characters.

I enjoy Wes Anderson's creative filming and directing and that's evident here. Love the khaki scouts and Bill Murray's character; I wish he had more of a presence. I found the 12-year-old troubled tween lovers disturbing, though. And if you're an animal lover, warning: a dog is killed in one awful scene.

At last I found a movie that my 54 year-old  husband,  my18 year-old son and I could agree was a great movie!  We have different tastes in movies but this one satisified them all!  We were mesermized until the end!

Wes Anderson, where have you gone wrong? I loved Rushmore and then Royal Tannenbaums a bit less. This movie has just fallen off the cliff. The look still has some appeal albeit the novelty is gone, it looks like a film made by the Instragram app. Bill Murray is excellent in another version of his broken man character but overall this film should be skipped.
Quirky but good.  Don't know what else to say. Words words words words words words words words words words words.

I am not really a Wes Anderson fan.  I rented this because my husband really likes the guy.  I was, however, just blown away by this movie.  It is a very sweet love story.  Now, it wouldn't be a Wes Anderson movie if there weren't at least a few "what just happened?" moments, but there were substantially less of those than with some of his other films.

Anderson's delightful story features great character performances by Bruce Willis, Bill Murray, Frances McDormand and Ed Norton. The lead characters are actually a pair of 12 year-olds who have respectively run away from the Khaki Scouts (think New England boy scouts) and her parents (wonderfully portrayed by Murray & McDormand).

The story takes place on a 12 mile long island (whose location is never quite identified, but is clearly in New England) that provides a nostalgic arcadian setting. There are cliffs, rivers, grass paths, forests, lagoons, Indian trails and no paved roads.

The dialogue isn't as snappy as "The Royal Tenenbaums" (but then, few movies are), but it's entertaining and at times, funny.
Quirky film, not really compelling....but some cute and funny moments. Not really my sort of movie-I prefer action or drama.
The previews showed you a cute quirky cast.  Didn't realize that it would go from cute quirky to just strange.  Didn't care for the movie at all.
movie is great. good movie. me like movie. buy movie and watch with friend. happy movie friend night. two more words required.

I enjoyed this odd yet funny movie regarding the romance between two young misfits and their equally misfit parents and cast.  I would give this 4 stars out of 7 but since Im limited to 5, Ill give it 3.  The scenery and music are very artistic and engaging but the movie never draws me fully into the plot.  The cute musical renditions during the final credits made me smile.

I would recommend this to anyone how enjoys off beat romantic comedies such as Miramax created before Disney.
Enjoyed it as much the second time I saw it. Charming story, great acting and visually, very different  Wes Anderson should get some Oscar nominations for this.

This is my favorite Wes Anderson movie yet.
It arrived in time and the disc was in place in its case when I opened it -extra yay.
A bizarre look into my marriage. My wife the bookworm and myself the over baked boy scout. Both social misfits. Both misunderstood but meaning no harm. LOL  Loved it!
I wanted to love this movie.  Unfortunately all of the parts that I loved, I had already seen in the trailer. Still cute, but I was a little disappointed.
I found the movie a little odd, but basically funny.  The new kids were great.  It left much to your imagination though.

we all want to be loved... to find the one we truly love and who truly loves us back.  well, what if you find each other when you are twelve?  what would you do?  obviously you would do anything and everything to preserve it and make it last forever.  and this is exactly what happens... with so many crazy twists and turns... until finally everyone comes to embrace the power of their love and help make this crazy story work.  it's a fun trip... enjoy
Funny, quirky, good time.  Would recommend to others for sure.  Bill Murray was great.  Best Bruce Willis role in awhile.
Outstanding--Francis McDormand and Bill Murray and Bruce and Edward all deliver over-the-top performances, not to mention the young man and young lady--
The movie was very touching.  It was a very unique coming of age movie.  I liked it very much.  Very enjoyable.

Wes Anderson has a near-perfect command of this movie.  His sets, dialogue, characters and plotting are immensely intelligent and entertaining.  There was one disturbing scene of sexuality but otherwise very good story, very good movie.

And as usual, Jason Schwartzman steals the show.
This movie is absolutely perfect. I can find no error in it. If you have not seen this movie, buy it this very instant.
lots of fun and great for everyone.the cast was perfect and scenery was beautifully captured.  I would put this on a must see list
Best Bruce Willis' movie since The Sixth Sense (1999). the picture is great and the plot develops very smooth, an entertaining movie.

I saw a preview for this on some really old recorded show and thought "why haven't I seen this already? Bruce Willis? Edward Norton? Bill Murray? I must watch it." Turns out these stars are more of background characters. I hoped it would be funnier and less, I guess, poignant. As other reviewers said, this is a stylish movie. I loved the details. It was kind of funny because my husband is the boy scout type and I'm the one who would bring a suitcase of books (actually I'd just bring a Kindle but this it's set in 1965 so I get it). It was very cute. However, the part on the beach got a little too Blue Lagoon for me. My husband thought that part was why the movie wasn't mainstream popular. For some reason I was really annoyed with the part where Edward Norton jumps across the water to save the Khaki Scouts leader or whoever it was. Overall, this movie was an interesting change of pace but definitely not what I'd call a "must see." Now I kind of want to watch the Royal Tenenbaums though.
If you like Wes Anderson's work, then you won't be disappointed with this film.  Quirky and excellent.  We loved it.
Moonrise Kingdom is by far my favorite movie of the year 2012. Incredible acting, visually wonderful, great music ...  Just magic.
If you like wes Anderson films you will love this movie. If not i think you may still like this movie.

Not everyone will enjoy this movie. Have to like site gags and absurdity.  Movie takes on romance, military and natural disaster movies in a comedic way. Don't know how the actors kept a straight face playing their roles. It's one of those movies that you'll watch when you feel like having a laugh.
DON'T REMEMBER EVER BUYING THIS, NOT EVEN AS A GIFT FOR ANYONE ELSE.  DON'T KNOW WHY YOU ASK ME TO RATE IT.
Watched with my 23 year old daughter and we both enjoyed this quirky little comedy. Beautiful artsy locations. Colorful. Sweet. Understated.
Loved this fun but meaningful movie. It is original with a great cast. Would recommend to anyone who enjoys something a bit different.

Wes Anderson does it again. Great story and perfect casting!

I loved the characters and the not so "normal" (though very "normal" to some) relationships and interactions.

Finding ones true self and that anyone can have a change of heart for the better is, in my humble opinion, what life is all about. That's just the way it is and I like it.
Exactly what I expect and enjoy about a Wes Anderson flick. It was shot beautifully and I loved the quirkiness of the characters.

I originally purchased this because the scene in the church is filmed in my own church, but after watching it i loved it. Wes Anderson knows how to make a movie that is so unique, strange, and visually appealing that it simply captivates the audience.
This movie does not disappoint great coming of age dramedy. The young actress that plays the lead very good I suspect this won't be the last we see of her

I've watched Amazon Instant Video before without any problems, so I rented this movie. Then I found that, like Comcast, Amazon has apparently switched to a version of Adobe's player that's incompatible with the browser version I have to use with my considerably-less-than-new Mac. I couldn't download the version of the player Amazon required, so I thought I couldn't watch the movie on Amazon, and though I looked and looked, I could find nothing that would allow me to cancel the rental. So I paid Amazon for a rental, but watched the movie elsewhere. This was disappointing, because I love Amazon and was happy to discover Instant Video several months ago.

I'm updating this to say that since I initially wrote my review, I found that I could download an older version of the player Amazon's using and still watch movies, here. It would have been nice if Amazon had let me know I could use an older version of the player, but I'm still happy.

As far as the movie that I had to watch elsewhere goes, I thought Moonrise Kingdom was okay, but not great. I'd read some fabulous reviews and came away wondering why.

I thought this movie was very charming, without being as over-the-top as some Wes Anderson films are. I thought the acting was great and the story was cute. Definitely see it. My boyfriend liked it more than I did, and he's usually not a big fan of Anderson's movies.
This is one movie that I plan on watching many times. I saw it in theaters and knew I had to own it.

Liked the story, it wasn't predictable and had several plot twists I didn't expect.
I thought this was better than "The Life Aquatic"
Warm and endearing story and beautiful cinematography.  Good family entertainment.  We really enjoyed this.  Amazon HD video quality was quite good.
Simple story told on screen with style and grace. Great use of space and camera movement. Beautiful film visually. If you like coming of age films this is one of the best I have ever seen.
This is a great movie for those that have a dry sense of humor. Just as his older films, if you love Dumb and Dumber or watch two and half men.... you will probably hate this movie.

If you like Wes...you'll love this movie.

Characters all feel familiar (not a bad thing), and the formula is perfect.  Laughs were had, and everyone felt great after it was over.
saw it in the theatre. had to get copy for my grandchildren to watch.  and scout masters too.  means for survival.

This film has quickly found it's way into my Top Ten Desert Island choices. Every aspect of it from the writing, directing, music and art directing, acting is perfection. I'm sure it will become "a Classic" that will wear very well over time since the primary issue that it deals with---the coming of age outsider's search for privacy and respect is such a universal experience.

I loved this movie. I've watched it many times, and I'm rooting for it to win Oscars. The established stars are great, especially Bruce Willis and Edward Norton, but the movie belongs to the two young actors, Jared Gilman and Kara Hayward. I've written about it three times (so far) on my blog:[...]
This is a brilliant magical movie.  I look forward to seeing it again, and I will undoubtedly buy a copy.
The premise of this movie is interesting but the filming is so odd that it seems awkward.  I can't recommend this movie.
We had read great reviews when this was in the movie theater. It was ok, quite slow. It reminded me of the slow pace of Fargo, but less entertaining.
Best movie I've seen all year!  Highly recommended to anyone that likes "quirky" films.  Great cast, great dialogue, funny, heartwarming, and a little weird (in the best possible way!)

Moonrise Kingdom is a fantastic visual experience that does not deserve the poor picture quality of Amazon's streaming service. We paid $5 for the HD version, not only was it not HD, it was worse than SD. I got a headache trying to focus my eyes on the pixelated images. I stream excellent HD quality movies with Netflix, so I don't know what Amazon's problem is,
I'm not a Wes Anderson fan, in fact, I barely understand most of his movies but this one is different.  I recommend highly.  There's a reason why this is on so many 'best of' lists.
Well scripted, well acted...This movie is a joy to watch from start to finish. It captures the wonderful, tender, funny, intense, naive, honesty of early adolescence.
I love this tale of young love and the trials of growing up when you don't quite fit the mold!  I am crazy about this story. It has a funny wacky side but also makes good life lessons.
Good story, great acting. All the characters really got into their mid 60's roles. This is a good "print", very easy to watch.
If you lived through the early 60's, you must see this. The scenes are beyond magnificent, and the story is as wonderful as could be. The dry humor had me pounding the chair, which I never do.

This film was not what I expected, but I loved it. It made me laugh and cry. The main characters are superb actors. The setting is gorgeous. If you are looking for something unexpected, quirky and something to make your heart melt, but not in a cheesy way, see this film.

Nostalgic, bittersweet, and funny, this is a lovely effort. Beautiful cinematography, loving and quirky direction, a knowing and sympathetic script, and deft casting make this a movie to enjoy again and again. Two misfits run away together on the eve of a hurricane and all must be made right before the literal lightning finale. Highly recommended.
With all the actor in this and Bruce Willis I thought it would be real good as it turned out it was just ok , a bit fractured for my taste.
There are some things you can just count on in this world, and getting a layered film from Wes Anderson is one of them.  A great family film too, with themes for all to appreciate.

This is one of those movies I had seen previews for all the time on TV and so I decided to go ahead and rent this movie to stream at home. It is a very interesting movie, but not quite what I was expecting it to be, but you definitely needed to keep watching to see how it would all end. I am all about quirky movies and this is definitely one of those movies with unique characters and storylines that you would only see in a movie like this, and for that reason I was a fan.
I had high expectations but found it to be quirky, difficult to follow and uninteresting.  It was a real disappointment. It was a waste of my time and the $3.99 rental fee.
This is a coming of age kind of movie.  It's not what I expected, but it was entertaining enough to watch all the way through.
Wes Anderson creates such magical places that you want to keep going back to!  The cast is perfect, the setting is perfect and the music is fantastic!

This movie screamed quirky - to such an extent that I felt it was really trying way too hard.  I usually like quirky movies, but this one just didn't do it for me.  Sort of a cross between Napoleon Dynamite and Big Fish, but it didn't work.

Wes Anderson might need a new movie concept.  This was too much like The Royal Tenenbaums (same palette, quasi-surreal sets, droll characters, etc.), but without its originality or narrative.  Movies need not be plot driven, but a little more narrative arc or a little more movement within the characters'  psyches would have made for a better movie.
Up front I will admit Wes Anderson can do no wrong in my eyes. Sweet story, great visuals, amazing soundtrack. I could copy and paste that sentence in a review for all his movies.
This movie was funny and quirky, sweet and sentimental. I highly recommend it for a family movie night .  The characters were well- developed throughout the movie.
The TV previews of this made it look really interesting but it was really lame. Perhaps not really the WORST but it was right up there. Don't waste your money on this one!
Funny, touching, suitable for almost the whole family, though very young children may not get it. Never thought I'd enjoy seeing Bruce Willis in a movie.
Bizarre, disjointed story and action.  Too over the top with unbelievable weather disasters and other events that did not go with this particular story.  Credibility was non existent.

I expected a bigger part for Bill Murray and Frances McDormand but they actually serve as a back drop for this 1960s humorous stereotype of summer camp boy scout life featuring a very different marches to his own beat scout who sets off on his own with a frustrated homebound girl on the Island where she lives. If you got Napoleon Dynamite and liked it, this may be your movie. Otherwise this may not be your film. I enjoyed the film, mildly funny, unique story, some very unusual surprises and certainly off beat.
Quirky and wonderful!  Great cast, wonderful characters, beautiful cinematography!  Highly recommend it! Well worth renting or owning.  I would watch it again!

If you have enjoyed Wes' other projects, this will not disappoint. All the fantastic cinematography we've come to expect is here, and a descriptive, enchanting world sprawls out from the first minutes of the movie. Edward Norton carries the movie as a no-nonsense Scout Master. Bill Murray's expected appearance relegated to sparse appearances, with little opportunity for humor.

The child actors aren't perfect, but the incongruity between Anderson's peculiar dialogue makes for funny and heartwarming scenes. Bruce Willis might seem completely out of his element as a small town cop with no Germans to blow up, but he still manages to carry his role well. The biggest gripe I have with the movie is how rushed it feels... particularly character qualities that aren't fleshed out properly.

Overall another good addition to the Wes collection and far better than most movies, but not his best.

I wish I could give this a million stars that is how highly I think of it.
I recommend this to any movie watcher who enjoys out of the box, inventive and quirky films. I had some members of my family view it and they didn't admire and "get" this movie, however; I am completely enamored with it.

The story line, the actors, the setting and Wes Anderson's vision is magical, other wordly and provides a view into a more simpler time where technology didn't dominate and control the world. Even though there are many "A- List" actors featured in this movie, the true focus of the film is on the two young lovers Sam Shucusky and Suzy Bishop. This movie offers an escape from this complicated and ever-changing world to the simple Island of Panzance- an imaginary island that is so quaint and beautiful.

I guarantee this film is worth watching not only once, but many times. Please try and have an open mind. Love the characters, embrace the oddities and become a part of the creative genius that Wes Anderson offers in his amazing "Moonrise Kindgom."
This film is much like "Life Aquatic" but without the Tiger Shark, or whatever it is, if it really exists.
This is such a cute story and told in the quirky way that only Wes Anderson can do. The streaming quality through amazon is another story, but the movie, YES, watch it!
Bill Murray....can't be too bad...good performances by the young leads....if you like off beat and weird you will like this one

He's already got a built in fan with me, but I'm not one of those that thinks Anderson walks on water or anything.  Not really a fan of Life Aquatic or Royal Tenenbaums, but Rushmore is one of my all time favorites, for instance.
I found this to be quite charming.  I love the idea of a child fantasy about young love and adventure come to life, if you will.
Odd that so many concentrate on the "quirky" side of the movie when the story itself takes over in my opinion.  I recommend it.

I am a big fan of Wes Anderson movies! I added this to my collection and have watched it several times since. It has the Royal Tenebaums dysfunctional family with an endearing story of young love. The cast and acting is phenominal.
A quirky and fun movie.  Definitely entertaining.  Solid performances by all.  We enjoyed it very much.  You won't regret seeing it.
It's a quirky gem of a movie.  Many layers to it that beg this movie to be re-watched.  Very enjoyable and priced right for rental thru Amazon

This was a sweet, fun, well written movie. I did not try and read too much into it. It was just entertaining without having anything too sad about it. I wondered if Bruce Willis wanted to make something his children could watch!
The whole family enjoyed this movie, it was really funny at times. It has a depressive sometimes disturbing under tone, but, isn't taken too far.
I didn't care for the movie and will turn around and sell it.  Sorry I wasted my money on it

While it covers most forms of preteen and early teenage attempts at understanding the adult world and breaking one rule or another, their view of adult behavior is presented with hilarity.  A true farce of several institutions with a star studded cast.

Ed Nortin and Bruce Willis steal the show with their characters. The story is pieced together the way you would expect from Wes Anderson. Its definitely one of my favorite from him. I just don't understand why the scene with lightning (no spoiler) existed.

Wes Anderson has finally conclusively proven that you can't just rely on stark cinematography and interesting costumes to make a watchable film. This dude needs to dedicate some more time to his scripts. I can't imagine how terrible this movie must've looked on paper. This hour-and-a-half long mess felt like three. I kept waiting for it to pick up and it finally did... About 45 minutes in when I slipped into a coma-like dream on my couch. That dream was a pretty good one. Fueled by my desperate need to escape the abysmal monotony of pointless masturbatory trash that had preceded it. This may be one or the worst movies I've ever seen. Don't let your pretentious friends make you believe you didn't "get it." There is nothing to get. This film is as deep as a Katy Perry song without the catchy hook. Whomever is responsible for giving Wes Anderson an unrestricted creative license needs to have their granting powers revoked. Looking at you, Weinsteins. Rushmore was good. Royal Tenenbaums was solid. Everything since has been absolute garbage. Anderson is the M. Night of indie films. Sooner or later I'll realize that there will never be another Sixth Sense. Just a constant flow of The Happening and Lady in the Water. Wished I'd rented Abraham Lincoln Vampire Hunter. At least I couldn't have possibly been disappointed.
To be honest with you I am not sure why we got this movie in the first place. It wasn't that good and I actually ended up falling asleep during it because it couldn't keep my attention.

The good: Two 12-year old eccentrics find friendship in each other. The bad: it's odd, unrealistic, and accentuates character flaws. At best, it's a spoof. At worst, an awkward plot that lurches from one silly episode to another.
loved it in the theater and am so glad to have it at home. (atleast until my daughter takes it back to college.)

The story was interesting, as were the characters.  They were a strange mix of quirky personalities that blended together in a quirky way.  Loved all the characters.  LOVED the music!  Be sure to watch the closing credits if you appreciate cleverness and great music.  I wish I could be more clever myself in writing this amateur review.  Bottom line: movie was very well done, clever and quirky (have I used those two terms before?), low key, quietly amusing and the music was great!  My mother introduced me to the orchestral piece by Benjamin Britten when I was a child, so that was an unexpected bonus for me.  Loved the movie!
For me this is the ultimate feel good movie. Makes me think of two of the most important things growing up, the Outdoors and first love.
Loved this quirky sweet movie from beginning to end. Great performances all around. Nothing typical about his delightful hilarious movie.
It's an OK movie.  It is pretty far out.  It isn't very credible.  It was long time ago that we watched it.
This was a strange but funny movie.  The kids in it are going to be great actors when they grew up.

I guess I didn't get the warm fuzzy feeling about this movie. I was really looking forward to seeing it. It was sweet & a bit weird.
I think it was supposed to be artist, For that I give it 1 thumb up
This is a perfect addition to the collection.  Very enjoyable and clever,  definitely a must watch movie.  I want to go on an adventure now.

The attention to detail from director Wes Anderson and the fantastatic cast make this a real gem! The movie really invokes the the feeling of the mid 1960s and although it is is purely a fantasy it is so much fun to watch. Highly reccomended!!!

It is an average Anderson film in it's looks, color saturation, etc. It has it's moments where the characters really make you laugh. As much as there is a decent amount of action and drama, if you aren't familiar with Anderson's film it COULD feel a little slow. Overall, I think it was a great achievement and Bruce Willis, Edward Norton, as well as the two teens, had good performances. I'd recommend it to anyone who wants to watch a quirky comedy.

If you have seen one Wes Anderson movie, you have seen them all.  Have you ever been to a place where every single person was quirky and acted exactly alike?  No?  Neither have I.  Not a single character in this movie even remotely resembles an actual human being.  We seem to be transported to planet Quirky which is inhabited by a bunch of clones who all act and think alike, and thus who are all extremely annoying.  I used to like Bill Murray (back in the "What About Bob" days), but he seems to have gone off the deep end in his movie choices over the past decade.  Save yourself a massive migraine headache and avoid this movie.
This is a very nice unsung film.  The very unusual plot and characters draw your attention.  After seeing it, we were amazed that it had not received more acclaim.
Its a quirky ride. Everything in this movie had me enchanted. I knew this would be a home run and it didn't let me down.

Take leave of your senses and roll in the barrel of fun. A mix-up of Boy Scout parody and "boy-meets-girl" with an ensemble cast of well-known actors supporting two less-known young actors as they run away to adventure, chase scenes, unnatural forces of nature, melodrama, romance, and fantasy on a beautiful wooded coastal island.

I tend to shy away from Wes Anderson movies because they're so stylized and screwy. And that's not to say that MOONRISE KINGDOM is NOT stylized and screwy. It is! But it is also charming and very, very sweet. The kids are amazing. Bill Murray, whom I do not like, is tolerable. Bruce Willis is almost unrecognizable, but he really has fun with his part. And the wonderful Frances McDormand does not disappoint. Play this one when you're feeling kind of grumpy and your spirits will lift immediately!

My daugher recommended that I watch Moonrise Kingdom - a very feel good movie - according to her.  It is a bit quirky but I enjoyed every minute of it - chuckling out loud at many times throughout the movie.  I would watch it again.

Just what you need after a long year at work...really a feel good movie.
Really makes you wish you lived there.
Silly. couldn't get beyond the first half hour. WAY OFF BEAT. Wouldn't recommend to anyone. Surprised they got the actors to agree to this film.
Really awesome movie. Heartwarming and touching. I didn't think they were going to make it , but they did. Get it.
fun cute movie great soundtrack nice family fun movie highly recommend all about innocent love. Quirky and dynamic good flick
I enjoyed this film. There were not too many boring parts. The music is nice but not excessive. The actors are simple yet distinct.
i love collecting movies and watching them of a winter when nothing is on tv and i cant get outside.

This is one dull & silly movie. Pointless & not worth watching. I had hoped for something a lot better.
.

What a great movie.  I can understand why it is on so many people's "Best 10" list.  A phenomenal cast who play it sweet and low.  They let the kids shine, yet make the movie as wonderful as it is.  Bravo!

Visually this movie is gorgeous.  I go back and forth on my feeling for Bill Murray--sometimes I love him in movies, other times, not so much, but he's great in here.  As is Bruce Willis, but the kids steal the show.  The little boy in his nerdy hipster glasses was fantastic.  We weren't expected to enjoy this so much, but both my husband and I did.  And I love the title too.
I love.this movie.beyond words. Edward Norton in a Khaki Scout uniform makes me impossibly happy. I.makes me wish I was young enough to run away from home again.
Just as good as the life aquatic. A must see movie if you are a Bill Murry or Bruce Willis fan
I bought this movie without hearing much about it, based on the actors/actresses.  I was really disappointed in it and wish that I had only rented it!
This a sweet love story with a quirky sense of humor. Wes Anderson captured the essence of the late 60's.
...this movie is for you. Every frame is a master piece. The humor is brilliant. I'd say every actor is outside his/her traditional role.
This is a quirky movie that is so interesting you just have to keep watching.  I love the acting in this movie.  The humor in this movie is quite dry, which I really love.  It's a keeper for me!
Charming, quirky and thoroughly enteraining movie.  Great sets, good music, wonderfully detailed period clothing and most of all, terrific acting.
I love this movie.  I have been a follower of Wes Anderson's movies since Rushmore but this has become my favorite so far.  It is delighful, adorable, a master piece...
Funny movie, and super witty.  There are a few scenes that I find inappropriate for kids that age, and can't imagine that parents would allow their children to do that for a movie.

I am not usually one for either "kid" movies or comedy and putting them together is usually an "avoid at all costs" for me...this Moonrise Kingdom is an exception to that longstanding rule.  I just loved it.  If you need a chuckle...enjoy.  That being said, my 17 year old daughter hated it...but my 14 year old loved it...so who's to say...perhaps my 14 year old had more in common with these wacky characters (and so do I).
Beautifuly told story with just enough quirkiness.  My favorite Wes Anderson work- just more fun than the others. Outstanding cast.
Great movie! If you like Wes Anderson's movies, this one is a classic. Fantastic Mr. Fox is another Wes Anderson movie
A funny, quixotic movie. Surprise characterizations by Bruce Willis and Edward Norton. Young love beautifully shown. A delightful, enjoyable movie beginning to end.
I loved the cast of this movie.  I loved that it was set in the 60's which were so confusing!  I grew up on the water and when scouts were an important part of growing up.  It was delightful.
The story was quite unusual.  I was surprised at how the relationship developed and that they actually got married like an adult.
Newest Wes Anderson and I love it! Probably the best one so far! If you like all his other films, just watch it!
It was a pretty good movie.  I was glad I watched it, but I probably won't buy it.  All the actors did great, the atmosphere is unique, definitely worth watching.
This was such a fun movie.  Made me think of my childhood and when I use to go off on adventures with my cousin.

MOONRISE KINGDOM addresses a problem that is prevalent at present in that we seem to be less educated about relationships, despite endless eBooks and blogs and regular books, and lectures/seminars from teams of goodwill popular gurus that can be hired for a price. Wes Anderson takes a different view by placing relationships under a microscope, using children to act out the fragilities and joys and consequence of allowing someone else into our heartspace. The result is a charming story about first love and coming of age that is respected by not only the writer/director Anderson, and the musical director Alexandre Desplat, but by a cast of both seasoned veteran actors as well as refreshing newcomers. It just works.

Set on an island off the coast of New England in the 1960s, as a young boy Sam (Jared Gilman) and girl Suzy (Kara Hayward) fall in love they are moved to run away together into the wilderness. Their moments together reveal a growing love and as they carefully step into the territory of first love relationships they gradually become physical:  conversations occur - `Sam: It's possible I may wet the bed by the way. Later, I mean. Suzy: Okay. Sam: I wish I didn't have to mention it but just in case. I don't want to make you be offended. Suzy: Of course, I won't.' and when hugging each other and having their first kiss the very simple words are so memorably sensitive `Suzy: It feels hard. Sam: Do you mind? Suzy: I like it.'  A storm brews and the `adults' begin a frantic search for the youngsters - Suzy's parents (Frances McDormand and Bill Murray) who state ``Our daughter's been abducted by one of these beige lunatics!', the scout master (Edward Norton), the Social Services person (Tilda Swinton) and the local sheriff Captain Sharp (Bruce Willis).  And it is this hunt that the meanings of the film fall into place.

When the youngsters are found, the conversations rings like `Sam: I admit we knew we'd get in trouble. That part's true. We knew people would be worried, and we still ran away, anyway. But something also happened, which we didn't do on purpose. When we first met each other, something happened to us. Captain Sharp: That's very eloquent. I can't argue against anything you're saying. But then again, I don't have to, 'cause you're 12 years old. Look, let's face it, you're probably a much more intelligent person than I am. In fact, I guarantee it. But even smart kids stick they're finger in electrical sockets sometimes. It takes time to figure things out. It's been proven by history. All mankind makes mistakes. It's our job to try to protect you from making the dangerous ones, if we can.' There is so much that can be said about this dear film, but nothing equals experiencing it.  Grady Harp, December 12

Considering the cast of well known actors I was expecting much more but was disappointed.
Maybe if you like dark comedy...

I'm not a member of the Wes Anderson bandwagon.  I've seen nearly all of his films, and I've enjoyed all of them.  The Royal Tenenbaums was his magnum opus.  But I would never call them great films.  I like the offbeat, lighthearted feel of them, but they never stand for anything.  I think they explore what it's like to be a moody, cerebral person in an age that lacks a defining conflict or purpose.  That's all well and good, but it's not great.
Set in the 60's, it has a slew of great actors. It is one of those kitschy movies that you just can't stop watching despite the absurdity of it all. Don't take it seriously and it is fun.

This movie started off a little strange, like maybe it was trying too hard to be weird. But it turns out it wasn't trying at all - it's naturally that way, which was so refreshing.
The portrayal of Social Services was coldly accurate, as I can attest from first hand knowledge of 'her'. The story was like having a wonderfully magical dream of childhood where kids do the right thing for each other and adults are mostly not shady, exploitative creeps. The delightful music reached into my body, got a grip on my spirit and pulled me along with the story like rushing down a river. The crescendos of music and plot were paired so perfectly that the movie felt almost interactive.

The acting in this movie was spot-on. Especially the child actors, those two were brilliant.

This is my new all-time second-favourite movie. Bruce Willis happens to be in the best movie ever created as well, so he must occasionally have fabulous taste in scripts. There is not a thing I would change about this movie. For my viewing pleasure, it was simply perfect. One of those kinda movies you are grateful for.

Simply put, a great movie should take you somewhere else and let you explore it. Moonrise Kingdom did exactly that, bringing the viewer to small island on the brink of a great storm with characters that are idiosyncratic but also universal. Music is an actor and not the background in this movie that captivates and keeps the audience on the edge of their seats looking for themes and anticipating the great fugue. Story telling done through film; putting most modern directing to shame by showing how easy it can look when done well.

Very happy that this comes in a combo pack.  This is my pick for best film of 2012.  If you're a Wes Anderson fan, you will notice his fingerprints all over this.  If you're unfamiliar with his work, then this is a great place to start.  He is, without question, an elite auteur.
Hilarious and witty. The epitimy of a Wes Anderson film. The best since The Life Aquatic. I will certainly watch again and again!
The kids were real, the dialogue was crisp, and it was not a rip-off, sequel, or CGI-fest. I've bought copies for 6 family members and a friend!
lovely movie, wonderful actors, a story for all ages.i can't  wait to watch it again with my daughter and grandsons!
Watched this with the whole family even though my 7th grader refused since she had already made up her mind that she was not going to like it. Standing ovation by all
I loved this film when I saw it in the theatre. Purchased it as a stocking stuffer for my young family.

This is one of Wes Anderson's best in my opinion.  It's charming, hilarious, and absurd.  It captures all of those awkward social moments in life without being too serious in a way that only Anderson can do.

It's perfectly acted, Bill Murray, Edward Norton, and Bruce Willis are all pros that never disappoint.

The young protagonists are fantastic as well playing adolescents - not yet adults, but not entirely children dealing with adult feelings.

It's amazing that such genuine human emotion and heart can be conveyed with such absurd and hilarious events.

This is easily the best film I've seen all year.

...until I saw Moonrise Kingdom. This is a cute, light comedy about the late summer antics of a couple of kids who try to get more adventure and romance than children are usually allowed.
The story and acting are superb - I especially like the way the a-listers  took on background characters to help emboss the pre-teen central characters, who were awesome.
After 30 minutes of pondering the weirdness in the shooting of movie, it suddenly dawned on me that the director was showing me this story through 12 year old eyes and did an excellent job of showing how a child may interpret the world at that age  - well done.

Awesome...saw it at the movies and knew right away I needed it for my collection.  If you like something different, fresh humor, and a movie where you can't begin to guess the ending, this one's for you.
Paid 15.. Wanted to pay 10... It was a gift so I had no choice but to pay the ridiculous prices of dvds
My kids loved it and so did I!  The characters were wonderful and very believable.  The kids starring in this movie were fantastic!!

Basic Boys meets girl moving, and Tween discovery in the 1960's. The depiction of the "Khaki" scouts, was funny and and a hazy romanticized reflection of the BSA at it's high point.

Unfortunately Bill Murray's character along with Bruce Willis'  where very one dimensional and uninspiring. While these actor can absolutely pull off dead-pan roles, it just didn't see to work in this film.

The films tempo build a sense of anticipation, vaguely like a clockwork orange, but never pays out.
A very boring movie, that was over rated.  Cute kid acting, but did not like this type of movie at all.
the child acting is strange and feels goofy, but fits right in with the awkwardness of the whole situation and makes for an entertaining film.
this is a very nice move, we enjoyed it a lot! I will recommend it to my friends ! !

This was an ok movie. The characters were well acted by a great cast but the movie never rose to the level of the hype.
The script was just so so. It felt like eating a meal and feeling hungry immediately after.
It tried to be off beat and quirky and fell flat on both counts.
Wait for it on TV.
This is such an excellent movie for people who went to camp as a kid and young love! Buy it!
The movie just didn't interest me. I regret ordering it. There wasn't much going on and I was bored to tears.
It was funny, witty & adolescently romantic(in a good way). I really didn't expect to like it as much as I did & that's what makes a great movie.
Some good acting, but the script wanders off into the deep blue sea. Lost in the storm. A waste of money to rent.

If you are a fan of his other work, you will not be dissapointed.  McDormand, Murray, Willis and Norton give good support, plus two kids that pull at the 'ol heart strings a bit.  For a moment there it was sort of like "Blue Lagoon" on acid.
If you liked The Darjeeling Limited or The Life Aquatic you will not dislike this film. I thought the movie was very well put together.
This movie was wonderful.  Bill Murray and Frances McDormand were great and the two young actors were excellent.  Appropriate for young teens through the elderly.
oh so funny and bittersweet at the same time.  I am amazed at the creativity to come up with this story!
One of the worst movies I have seen in along time, and which is sad considering the actors is this. I wish I could get a refund.
Great movie, husband can't have enough , so I had to buy it for him for Christmas ! Plus we are fans of Bill Murray , great actor!

This film took my heart. I loved the Royal Tannenbaums and Fantastic Mister Fox, but the honesty of this little jewel is like a piece of rich dark chocolate (70% or higher) wrapped in marzipan. The colors and the fact that the principlel characters are so young might fool you, but the story is firs rate and the actors are amazing.

this movie wasn't widely publicized, or even seen (until I got my 1st DVD); it will be viewed as one of the best cult movies in history, and I am so glad it is now nominated for a Golden Globe. I loved it so much I bought a 2nd copy as a gift! characters/actors can't be beat, and the story line is as incredible as the settings are!
Another wonderful Wes Anderson movie with great re-watch value.  Looking forward to the criterion version when it becomes available in the future.

We saw this in the theatre and we loved it. Couldn't wait for it to be released. Highly recommend this sweet, funny and poignant film. The script is wonderful, the acting was great and the cinematography is fabulous. All with no violence to speak of and no swearing either

Yes it's mannered, precious, East Coastaphilic stuff, but I enjoy the acting and meticulous precision of Wes Anderson's films, including this one.  I'm rarely if ever emotionally affected but I love the recreation of the world through the eyes of someone with a unique vision.
More genius from Wes he remembers twelve year old love, angst, and alienation which is no small feat how do you rate greatness?

OK, am I the only person on the planet who hated Moonrise Kingdom?  At first, I was thinking , "Perhaps I am just dead inside", but my roommate wasn't crazy about it either.  She didn't hate it.  "I didn't have the violent reaction you did."  But, when pressed, she said she would not recommend it to a single person on the planet, nor would she ever watch it again, and she also felt that, at 94 minutes, "it was really long".  When I saw the trailer, I could not have been less interested.  I loved Rushmore, and especially loved The Royal Tenenbaums, but I  hated The Darjeeling Limited, and hated The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou (something I found particularly crushing since I loved some of Wes Anderson and Noah Baumbach's previous efforts).  So, given the trailer, and TLAWSZ and TDL, I was not excited about Moonrise Kingdom.  However, it seemed like everyone said how great it was, and it got terrific reviews, so I finally rented it, thinking maybe it was just a crap trailer.  Nope.  The film is exactly like the trailer, but an interminable 94 minutes long.  The first 45 minutes, I hadn't gotten to the point where I was hating it, but I was not at all engaged.  Then, at around the 45 minute mark, there was about 1 second of a moment that resembled something moving.  I thought, "Thank Christ!  Perhaps now we'll find the heart that's been missing thus far."  NOPE.  As the film wore on, I started mentally counting down the remaining minutes, gritting my teeth, and periodically heaving sighs.  Moonrise Kingdom plays up Wes Anderson's worst impulses, with nothing to back them up.

Afterward, in full rant mode, I told my roommate that I was not exaggerating in the slightest when I said I'd found Hallmark commercials more moving.  Finally, I exclaimed, "I hate Wes Anderson!  We're in a fight!"

Moonrise Kingdom has a 98% rating on Rotten Tomatoes.  ?!?!?!  Miami Herald says, "Most of Wes Anderson's previous pictures came from the head; Moonrise Kingdom is one from the heart."

wrong, Wrong, WRONG!!!

Ugh.  I WANT MY HOUR AND A HALF BACK!

1 out of 5 stars because even the score and soundtrack annoyed me (unlike Rushmore and The Royal Tenenbaums).
My family liked the movie, but the whole story was a little strange and pointless.  The acting wasn't all that great

I have been a fan of director Wes Anderson for many years. It's not the promise of a blockbuster and fat paychecks that lure big names like Bruce Willis, Edward Norton, and Bill Murray to star in his movies - it's his ability to so brilliantly portray the absurdity and wonderment of life, and more specifically in this film - childhood. Moonrise Kingdom is a work of art and quite simply beautiful to behold. It sucks you right in and you forget the world outside your screen. I dislike writing detailed reviews of movies because of spoilers but I will say that this is a fantastic film that audiences of all ages will adore!

I gave five stars for a great movie. Also, Amazon was quick to deliver my purchase. The combo pack allowed me to get the digital copies in itunes. note: this was difficult in the past i had issues downloading digital content because of false time expiration issues.
it was amazing. Wes Anderson did it again! I love this movie and believe everyone should watch it! thanks so much!

No idea what to expect but delighted with what I got. Quirky, funny, touching, this movie would be an excellent date night rental. Great characters in various touching situations. No, no car crashes, gun fire but it is really good for what it is. Recommend highly.
The collection of actors in this Wes Anderson flic compares to none before!  From beginning to end, any Wes Anderson fan will love this movie!
This film is definitely one of the top films for 2012! I loved it but even more my boyfriend is crazy for it! I can't wait to give this to him for Christmas so we can watch it whenever we want :)
This movie arrived at my house promptly. It was soo good I watched it twice the first night it arrived. I loved it so much I decided to buy a few more to give to people as Christmas gifts.
Brimming with complex relationships. Youthful charm and understated slightly surreal humor. This is one of Anderson's best. This combo pack is how all movies should be produced.

One of my favorite movies of all time.  I love Wes Anderson.  If you liked Royal Tennanbaums you will love this.  If you haven't seen that one get it too.  Lovely love story, very unusual in a charming way.  Most will love it if not all.  Great retro 60s setting.  For those who don't like it, meh, there is always a grinch in the crowd.

Strangers in many ways  classic song "For All We Know" from The Carpenters.

This movie starts out sort of strange. However after watching it for a while it gets sort of strange. Everything gets wrapped up in the end as it is sort of strange.

Two twelve-year-olds fall in love and run away together. They are pursued by all who care, from relatives, kaki scouts, police, welfare, and a storm.

Lots of exadurated personalities. However it is just as I remember it as a youth. So maybe it is not so exadurated. There is a welfare lady could be a character right out of a Roald Dahl story.
I wanted to like this movie and it did have its moments but mostly I found myself looking for stuff to read during the movie to keep me even halfway engaged...
Well, obviously this movie isn't for me. I couldn't care less for it. Looks like some people who get the movie like it. Suffice to say, it's not for everyone.
i love this movie. I bought this just so i would have my own copy. There is not much else to say.
This would be a five star family movie if it weren't for one scene where a dog is hurt.  Otherwise it is funny and heartwarming.  Truly enjoyable story.
When we finished watching this my husband said, "You didn't like it".  I did like it, A LOT.  It is just so quirky and untraditional...very cute!!

This a one of those movies that seems to work on many levels.  The story is quite ridiculous on one level but it deals in a very real way with the angst of children growing up.  The ongoing description of Purcel orchestral piece is surprising and pleasing, the acting  and directing are superb.  We have watched it several times in the DVD and the BlueRay.  The BlueRay version was hard to boot up for some reason.
Definitely buy this Moonrise Kingdom set above just the DVD, you get your monies worth here, for just a couple bucks more.
loved this film and can't wait to give it as a gift for xmas - it is well worth watching again

Great cast and direction
My whole family got caughtbup in this awesome coming og age film
Kudos to the whole cast of young actors. Willis, Norton and Murray were great
This is one of the quirkiest  most delightful movies I've ever seen.  I heard a review that put it well - it's about a lot of dysfunctional adults who come together for the sake of the kids.

It's a Wes Anderson movie, so I really enjoyed it. I also enjoyed the fact that I could rent it, because I don't watch movies over and over again for the most part. So it declutters my movie selection.
Wes Anderson fans will take great delight in this release. Others should find it charming and engaging. It's a funny movie with a wonderful cast.

As a big fan of Anderson's Rushmore and The Royal Tenenbaums, and even a fan of The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou, I had high hopes for Moonrise Kingdom, especially given the positive reviews - an 84! on Metacritic.

I was very disappointed in Moonrise Kingdom. Still trying to figure out what it was about: first love? pre-teen angst? precociousness? how parents/adults scar their and other kids? the soul crushing evils of living under the boot licking heel of the pseudo- boy scout state (to paraphrase Big Wednesday)?

It was the weakest of stories IMO, with more than pedestrian dialogue. Now, perhaps non-fans of Anderson's works would make the same complaints about his other movies, some of which, like Rushmore, I think are great movies. But Moonrise Kingdom to me comes across as a half-assed effort at story-teling and film making.

YMMV
A little Quirky but cute.  I loved it. The life of a very dysfunctional family and two very lonely kids.

Not funny - this style is just TIRED.  It peaked at the life aquatic - and that one may have just been lucky since Bill Murray and Jeff Goldblum carried it.  Each iteration appears to get less funny - same art style.

Pass on Wes until there is a Life Aquatic 2.
Watched it due to great ratings, but my wife and I hated it so much we didn't even finish watching.

After watching the trailer, I knew this was going to be kind of a quirky, odd movie, which is great because that's the kind of comedy I like. This movie at least succeeded in being different, but I kept waiting for it to get not only funny, but more interesting. The two main kids' characters are almost robot-like, speaking in short monotone sentences. I understand that was part of the characters -- not bad acting -- but it got old pretty fast. Overall, I'd have to agree with what a few other reviews here said: The movie was OK, but the best stuff is in the trailer.
The best part of this movie can be seen by watching the movie trailer - very disappointed in movie particlulary given the actors.

I ordered the Blue-ray/DVD of 'Moonrise Kingdom' and got an e-mail stating that I get the Amazon Video On Demand version for free. I thought this was a pleasant surprise until I went to view my video library and it was listed as a 24-hour rental that expires in one month. There is nothing in the e-mail that I received indicating that this video is a rental or that it expires. Granted, I did not order it and was not expecting it, but the e-mail was misleading enough that I'm giving the video 1 star even though the movie itself was excellent.
Quirky film as you would expect from W.A.  Not quite up to Rushmore, Bottle Rocket, but the two young characters to a decent job.  Small roles for Edward Norton, Bill Murray.
Lots of great actors in strange character roles, gorgeous set decoration and costumes, hilarious dialogue, all the hallmarks of a great Wes Anderson film. I could watch it over and over.

Every performance is "spot on" in this coming of age movie. I highly recommend this movie to the mature teenager on up. Many moments are heart warming AND downright hilarious. It will be a treasure in my library for years to come. Note that this movie is NOT for those without a quirky sense of humor!
My new favorite movie - Wes Anderson is a genius.  Features the music of Benjamin Britten and his children's opera Noye's Fludde (Noah's Flood).  WONDERFUL.
This movie was a little odd for me. Most of the characters didn't seem to fit their roles. It is a great story and the acting was good, it just never came together for me. AKWARD!
love the soundtrack and the story is quite sweet. recommended for anyone tired of recycled storylines and wants something clever and entertaining!

A charming story that captures the innocence and youthful wanderlust of nomadic and gypsy souls. Delightful to see the misunderstood find understanding in love because of and despite differences. LOVED it.
One of the best I've seen in forever.  Such a great view from a young person's perspective.  Acting and settings are wonderful.  A joy.

Moonrise Kingdom was very well done, and good for a couple of hours of escape from the real world. I think many viewers will see a bit of themselves in one or more of the main youth characters. Enjoy!
A great collection of fine actors.  The two young people were outstanding.  Good flick.  Like a Cohen brothers movie.  Makes you think.
Love this movie.  It is quirky and fun and if you love plaid you will love this movie.  A good time was had by all.

This movie is quirky, well acted, and wonderful.  The characters in this movie are great and well-developed.  The direction style really ads to this movie.  Moonrise Kingdom is funny, touching, sarcastic, and a little sad all at one time.
Odd and quirky is the simplest review of this movie.  Wes Anderson has certainly captured the sentiments and errant emotions of the adolescent. Certainly worth viewing more than once.
My favorite movie of the year.  Was a scout in the 60s and it brought me right back.  My mental age of 15 may have helped.  It's just so sweet and so well done.  We give it as gifts.
Saw it at our local art house theatre.  Bought it for my 8 and 11-year-old grandkids for Christmas.  Other than one brief scene, I feel it's age appropriate and the kids will really enjoy it.

I avoided this in the cinema and then was chided by a friend that I followed the "If there's a heavy advertising campaign, avoid the film" self-imposed rule.  Oh, if I had only followed my instinct.  This is a waste of time.  It's hard to imagine that so much production value was put into something that had so little going for it: just a plain old bad script and horribly understated acting.
This was a good watch. Light hearted and fun but still with that classic Wes Anderson feel that you know and love.

We watched this movie as a family (youngest child is 11) and we all really enjoyed it. It's fun, funny and quirky, a great story of youth, romance and adventure. Wes Anderson did a great job putting it all togther, beautiful cinematography.

Are those miniatures making up those movie sets?  I read very mixed reviews of this movie before I saw it.  I'm a big Wes Anderson fan, though I think, lately, he's been relying too heavily on his stylized tricks.  This is sort of the impression I got from some critics.  So, I had somewhat low expectations, which may have been a good way to approach this film.  Because it was funny, clever, and had that mesmerizing quality of his earlier movies (Rushmore, Royal Tenenbaums, and his not stylized--and first--Bottle Rocket), and Fantastic Mr. Fox.  And it has an awesome cast.  It won't be my favorite of his films (that spot will continue to be held by The Royal Tenenbaums), but it's going to keep at the top of the list.
This was a fun movie and I thoroughly enjoyed watching it. Kindof reminded me of the movie The Royal Tanenbaums the way it was acted and narrated.
Unique story, funny yet touches the heart too, creative and a champion for those "nerd" of society.  Excellent acting by the children star, and a very unusual period movie.
Highly entertaining. I loved the story and cinematography.  I will watch this again and again. I really enjoyed the characters.
This was a so-so movie.  It was difficult to keep track of the story line.  It did have big name actors to keep interest where lesser actors might not have given the story.
Not my favorite Wes Anderson film, but I really enjoyed it. Love the cast and plot. Soundtrack is excellent as always. Wouldn't suggest renting this if you aren't a Wes Anderson film fan.

Wes Anderson creates a world of surprises and mostly satisfying performances, a movie with no greater message than humanity is a fascinating subject, regardless of time and place.  Bruce Willis and Edward Norton are in their parts and all's right with the film.
This just isn't an entertaining movie. It wasn't funny. I have no idea why they made this movie. It was a waste of time!

Well done. We really enjoyed this film, in spite of the rather obtuse plot. Lots of fun, and without the usual reliance on adolescent sexual innuendo, sometimes confused with actual humor (see SNL), so pervasive in media today. There are a couple of scenes that really are somewhat inappropriate, as they portray children in sexual situations, but they are pretty mild. All in all, though, pretty funny and full of surprises. Few films surprise me these days, so it was a nice departure.

Wes Anderson's best film since "Rushmore". This is a real gem. Super-stylized but it works. Wonderful cast, especially the two young leads. A great lyrical ode to the rush of first love, and of finding your soulmate .
I enjoyed this film. It was a fun movie the cast is great. Needed a little more humor. "Tonight.... im going to kill myself." lol
This is a good story about kids and adults, courage, loyalty, and resourcefulness. The film looks retro but the truths work today. All the acting is good.
If you don't have anything else to do, this would be OK to watch, probably. I rented it because of Bruce Willis.

One of the absolute best films I have ever seen! Moonrise Kingdon beautifully reminisces on the childhood adventure in all of us. It portrays the wonder and lore of discovering new lands in the imagination of a child. The film takes place in rural coastal Maine, which is an ideal setting for this theme. All in all, Moonrise Kingdom is a phenomenal film sure to stir up sentimental feelings of the childhood in each of us.

I really love the story and the way Wes Anderson tells it.  It is visiual.  I saw the film in theater and found compelling but knew I would want to watch it again, because visuals are so complex.  I was disappointed with the extras on the Blu-ray.  Usually his films have extensive extras.
Brilliant! One of a kind. Uniquely cute. One of the best movie made in the last decade. Definitely a keeper.

The Royal Tenenbaums was very good; Moonrise Kingdom is beautifully great.

Wes Anderson took a story that romanticizes childhood yet injects some hard truths of real life -- parents that don't love each other, a child kicked out of his foster home, a sad middle-aged policeman, a young difficult girl, self-important scout leaders -- and does it all in an uplifting and very artistic way.

It is hard to imagine just getting the basic plot and dialog right to pull off such a feat without coming across as syrupy, a downer, leave-it-to-Beaverish, overplayed, underplayed, etc.  Yet he not only did that, he added such wonderful cinematic (and very Wes Anderson) visuals along with the story, layered with all sorts of subtle recurring themes and inspired musical choices.

I'm a pretty stoic guy, but it's hard for me not to slightly tear-up in the end when the young man slips out the window with "Cuckoo" being sang by the boys' choir -- both tying up a recurring theme of the movie while so perfectly ending the work of art that is this film.
