I so truly admire Wes for creating something so original, so beautiful, so sweet yet so hard, so multi-layered, so artistic, just so plain enjoyable to watch again and again.

I'd give it 6 stars if I could.
The kids kissing on the beach is a little racy for us but funny as well. We laughed well into the night on this one.

Its a great movie (5 out of 5 stars) but lets talk about the product!

I agree with other posters on how the cover looks like someone who hasn't watched the movie make it. The blu-ray is lacking as far as the great commentaries which is expected since its not criterion collection and that is why I gave it only 4 stars. Contains scene walk through for the blind which I thought was cool.

As usual, shipped quick and nicely packaged from Amazon, thanks guys

...but the fact that there are so many pieces of his other works make this a magical movie.  It garnered a great deal of press and I don't really know why because so many of his other works are, dare I say it, better - but this is a sweet, even if slightlly off-putting addition to my collection.  Even if your not a WA fan, it's still a good movie to have seen.

Moonrise Kingdom, in my opinion, is probably Wes' best film yet. It's a sweet coming of age story with an ensemble cast that gels to take you into the world of Sam and Suzy, the misunderstood main characters and their well meaning but dysfunctional family, friends and fellow townspeople. The cinematography is worth a viewing alone. Add witty and poignant dialogue and a wealth of career-high performances from Bruce Willis, Frances McDormand, Bill Murray and Edward Norton as well as the leads who play "Sam and Suzy" and you have a funny and tender film that you'll enjoy time after time.

"Moonrise Kingdom" was one of the best films of the year and my daughter is delighted to have her own copy.
It was delivered promptly and in perfect condition.

I was prepared to like this movie. Word of mouth reviews from others had been good.
But when I realized the child actors in the movie are in a sexual relationship and the young teen actress is in her underware for quite a few scenes, I was disenchanted.
What is wrong with the parents of these child actors to allow them in a movie with such sexual overtones.
Yuck!
Husband commented that its one of the best movies he's seen. And he's picky :) I totally agree with him and love all Wes Anderson films!
I usually like thrillers and sci fi, but this was an over the top wonderful movie. Don't miss seeing it!

I watched the movie for about 30 minutes and couldn't watch anymore.  Although I appreciate and enjoy quirky, independent films, this completely missed the mark for me.  I couldn't connect with any of the characters because there was really no character development.  It was as if the screenwriter and film maker said, "lets put together some crazy, quirky characters and see what happens."  For me, their experiment failed.

I have every movie Wes Anderson had directed, so I had to own this! I saw it twice in theaters with two very different groups of friends. One groupe loved it as much as I did, and the other groupe hated it.. Oh well.... It's not as good as 'Life Aquatic' but its better than 'The Darjeeling Limited'..
This movie was boring and felt long. My husband liked it more but I spent the time surfing the web.

I watched this not really expecting to like it. I'm a Bruce Willis fan in the Die Hard genre and this is very different for him but he is wonderful as the almost bumbling cop. The movie works I think because of the stellar cast and yet none of them steal the show. That role is taken by the young stars. A really charming movie. I loved it
I got this movie for my boyfriend. He is a really big Wes Anderson fan. The movie is super cute and fun.
Wes Anderson continues to make charming fun filled films with quirky characters that create their own world, enjoyed this film from start to finish. Hope it does well come awards season.
Campy. Quirky and fun.  A really great rental.  I do not know why it did not get more attention.  Kids. Were goof actors.

I liked it, my spouse fell asleep..... a definition of independent film? The name actors disguise its dry quirky humor.
Beyond quirky, a sharp critique of bullying and being something other than an average main stream adolescent through the lens of boy scouts and coming of age.
I really thought it would come off as a joke, the kids silly. Really it was well acted and sincere. I liked the movie, a lot of sad life lessons but told in a understated way.
Great movie. Although it may seem like a movie for kids, this dramedy is full of excitement and dry humor.
This is a really funny well made movie. First Bill Murray movie where he is not unfunny (doesnt mean he was funny). We loved it!
really good movie. watched it dozens of times already. saw it in the theatre, couldn't wait for it to come out
I chose this rating because it was a perfectly made movie. The actors are terrific and the plot is original!
Weird, but in a nice way. Also a little Addams Family feel to it...but dry humour in this movie is refreshing.
I loved the music, the visuals, the young actors, and the story. I tell everyone to watch it and have listened to the soundtrack countless times.
That's just the way it was growing up.  One of the best movies I've ever seen.  See if you don't agree.

I was excited to see this movie, so I rented it first. Then, it was just as unique and fun as I expected it would be, that I had to go buy it. Had a nice Independant film vibe, much like the other great movies by this writter/director.

I'm a huge Wes Anderson fan, so I might bit a little biased here. This movie surprised me SO much, in the best way possible. All the big names you went to the movie for are really supporting characters... the kids are the base of this movie. Heartwarming and so freaking CUTE (in a dark independent sort of way, of course). This is now one of my favorites!

A very stylized movie which can be good if it adds to or enhances the story.  In this case,  Wes Anderson and crew manage to use quirky camera angles, interesting sets, and artistic color correction to create a very entertaining movie.  It is very funny in spots, has good characters and a good ending.  The filming style was what I liked most about this movie. It really enhanced the story.  When I saw the ad for this on the slides that they show before movies start,  I was not interested.  The synopsis on the slide was: " A 12 year old boy and girl run away and have the people of a small island town looking for them as a storm approaches"  The slide also showed a picture of some old 1960's stuff like a record player on a beach.  Not good advertising.  When I watched a preview and realized who the director was I decided to watch it.  So if you like quirky, funny stories filmed in a very interesting way then you should see this film.
Quirky tale of coming of age... GREAT cast!! Very funny and enjoyable to watch a few of the actors step out of their usual element. Love anything Wes Anderson does.

This film was pretty cool for the most part, very polished and great production design, I kinda like the "little kid who acts like an adult" angle, but it was just a little "too cutesy" to me - it was like someone's thesis film that was made longer and had more money thrown at it.
uniquely quirky coming of age story implying 1950s setting; understated, subtly intelligent and funny performances by all,especialy the younsters. .

My wife doesn't have a dry sense of humor like I do, she walked in while I was watching this, she lasted about two minutes. I love The Life Aquatic, I love Bruce Willis and Bill Murray, the whole cast was great. It's a fun story, if you like movies like The Life Aquatic check this one out. It was Super Great, I couldn't watch this movie the dozen or so times I watched The Life Aquatic, but the first go was great.
its a weird trippy movie but i loved it tho if you want a funny movie id recommend this one
Good movie, however I could have done without the "death of the dog" scene and the "coming of age/discovery" scene was unnecessarily long.

Moonrise Kingdom is a classic. It will rise to the status of cult film easily. The actors are perfect, the story is interesting and odd, the direction is unique. When I saw it at the movies I sat there with a stunned smile on my face the entire time - I could not believe my good fortune at watching such a treasure.

BUY IT. WATCH IT. LOVE IT.
this movie has a very mixed cast of very good actors. the story line was really good and each character had his own quirkieness and slightly abnormal behavior to make for an entertaining movie.
Moonrise Kingdom is a jewel of a movie.  The plot is unpredictable and entertaining.  The movie puts actors against type and the result is you are continually surprised and entertained.
a movie to lift your spirits and make you laugh...take a trip to the Moonrise Kingdom and be entertained; a must see.

This was a lot like a lot of other movies. Quirky outsider kids, absurd grown-ups. Much like the Royal Tenenbaums or Life Aquatic. Other Wes Anderson movies are better. That isn't to say this was awful, and I watched the whole thing instead of turning it off, it just wasn't anything special.

Really enjoyed this quirky movie. The draw would seem to be the stellar cast, but the two kids steal the show. They are so serious and trying to act so grownup in their quest to simply be together. It's very silly, touching and funny all at the same time. I'm a fan of offbeat movies to begin with, so this is right up my alley! Very funny and entertaining!
The cast is excellent and the story is whimsical and sort of innocent, with a lot of texture, sort of like reading a children's picture book.

I love the movie and the quick service in receiving it. Moonrise Kingdom is a quirky sweet story with lots of crazy loveable characters who grow on one each continued viewing. I watch it over and over again.
This moving was quirky cute - I'm just discovering a love for Wes Anderson movies, and this was the best yet!

This sick movie depicts 12 year old children engaging in sexual interaction.  How far the interaction goes I cannot say because I stopped watching it as soon as the 12 year old girl french kissed the 12 year old boy (they were both in their underwear) then commented on him becoming sexually aroused at which point he proceeds to start feeling up her breasts.  That is the point at which I stopped watching it so I don't know if it proceeded to depict them taking off their underwear and having intercourse or not, but it would not be surprising given that the director and producers of this movie are clearly very disturbed and perverted individuals who enjoy watching children interact sexually.  I intend to contact the U.S. Attorney's office to ask that they investigate the makers of this film to determine if they violated any laws.  Having two child actors essentially sexually molest each other should be illegal but I am guessing that Hollywood may have an exemption under the guise of creating "art" so that they can legally do it.

This move is repulsive and anyone who is not a sexual deviant will not be able to enjoy it.  The preview made it seem like a quirky comedy about dysfunctional families and the presence of very talented and well known actors gives the impression that it will be a very enjoyable movie.  Nothing about the movie was enjoyable.  The characters are not engaging, watching it was uncomfortable even before it devolved into child sexual interaction, and the thematic content is also disturbing on other levels with child-on-child violence and brutality as well.  In short, there is nothing whatsoever about this movie to recommend, and the fact that the making of the movie caused children to molest each other should motivate any normal person to avoid it.  I would NEVER have rented this movie if I had known that it was so perverse and I call on Amazon and every other distribution vehicle to place a warning on this movie so that children are not exposed to its perverse content.  This movie is proof positive that the rating system has become utterly worthless because if this movie does not contain content that no child should be exposed to (meaning at least an R rating), then I don't know what would.

Avoid this film and protect your children from being exposed to it at a friend or neighbor's house by letting other parents know how perverse and disturbing it is.

Loved this quirky, clever, soul satisfying movie. The big name actors (Bruce Willis, Edward Norton, Frances McDormand, Bill Murray, Harvey Keitel) did a wonderful job downplaying their larger-than-life selves and letting the two teenage stars shine. The adults were a wonderful supporting cast for the two young stars. Highly recommend this movie.

Part of the Movie was filled in Trinity Church, Newport RI - where I grew up as my father was the rector from 1954-1971.  Saw it in the theatre and got the DVD to see it again in slow motion if necessary - and the whole story and acting grew on me.  Nice to see Bruce Willis and Tilda Swinton in down to earth roles - just a deligthful "little" movie.
I heard it was a very good movie so watched on dvd. I just didn't get it. It was boring and uneventful. I wanted to laugh, forced a few chuckles out to try and enjoy it but no luck.
Not a laugh riot, but not a crying movie either. It has its poignant moments interspersed with gentle humor. Enjoyable.
Exceptional movie on so many levels.  Will be enjoyed by all but the very young.  I would definitely encourage friends to watch and collectors of good films to buy.
Maybe this was based on a book or something? If so, maybe the book is much better. I just thought the storyline was hard to follow and didn't really get the point.

This thoroughly enjoyable yarn will delight all those who love the art of storytelling with a big dose of irony and comic twists.  It will be especially appreciated by adults with young hearts and open minds.  Don't bother with this one if you insist upon the standard fare that continues our society's worship of criminals and high body counts.  No guns, no blood, no scumbags.  This is a rich tapestry of young love and some really interesting adult characters who support a twisting and turning adventure story.  Your reward will be collected when the young heroes conclude their quest.  However as wise connoisseurs of great storytelling, we suspect there will probably be more adventures to come  they are just those kind of people.  Will they live happily ever after?  Yes, or at least their version of happiness.  And you will too.
Good cast. Some of the kids will probably grow up to be adult stars a la "Stand by Me".  A bit slow at times.

This is not a Bruce Willis or Bill Murray movie.  The stars go to the young performers in this funny tale, although Edward Norton and Cate Blanchett are pretty memorable.

A must see for the entire family, and quite possibly the best first kiss ever in film!
fell asleep so it's tough to give a true evaluation.  However, I doubt I will give it a second try.

The bizarre humor was worth seeing,  however, i wouldn't recommend it be aloud fir any kid under 16. There is no language problem or nudity, but the sexual intrigue might be tempting in a more sane way
Once you've seen the whole movie, you get how they were able to cast so many stars. Very cute, artistic, charming and perfectly charming.

This movie is the first Wes Anderson directed movie that we've seen, and now we're eager to rent all of his movies. This style reminded me of Stars Hollow from Gilmore Girls and the off-kilter world of Pushing Daisies. Having stars like Bruce Willis, Edward Norton, Bill Murray and Frances McDormand just add to the enjoyment of the unique world that has been created.  The bottom line is that if you don't enjoy quirkyness comedy, you won't like or understand the movie.

I thought this was going to be a fun movie with interesting interaction between Bruce Willis and Bill Murray, instead it turned out to be a movie on badly raised children doing stupid dangerous things.
My high expectations of this movie were more than met.  Amazing cast of actors, great screenplay. My only regret is only renting it, instead of buying it :) *****

Okay, misspellings in the title were on purpose, but this was one strange movie! I can't say it was terrible, nor was it fantastic. There were some good moments, but many of the child actors are way too smart/knowledgeable for their ages. The premise? It was just a bit too fantastic. But if you're bored and this is the only movie available, its worth a look.

It brought back fond memories of my own early years  The film captures the innocence of the '60's era perfectly, blending  humor (I laughed all the way through it) with dysfunctional family problems and the magic of falling in love for the first time.
Wes Anderson's best work to date.  Willis, Norton, Murray, McDormand, Swinton and Keitel...a great cast and a wonderful story!  Add this to your collection!

Wes Anderson's best films seem to be about young people, rather than the neurotic adults for which he became famous, and "Moonrise Kingdom" is his most youthful effort yet. It takes place during the summer of1965, on a sparsely populated island somewhere in New England. Twelve-year-old Sam Shakusky (Jared Gilman) has resigned his commission and gone AWOL with a miniature canoe and some supplies from a Khaki Scout camp under the command of Scout Master Ward (Edward Norton). The local authority, police Captain Sharp (Bruce Willis), goes looking for Sam only to discover that Suzy Bishop (Kara Hayward) is also missing from her parents' home. The young couple have apparently run off together, just as a hurricane works its way up the coast.

Sam and Suzy have a hard time getting along with people, but they see themselves in each other and hit it off right away. In spite of their frustrations, they're full of youthful optimism and a yearning for adventure. And they go out and have that adventure, leaving the adults to worry and search frantically for them. These two young actors are very appealing, and their antics, however eyebrow-raising are sympathetic and funny. The adults are also sympathetic, if a bit disengaged from life until this incident galvanizes them. -With the exception of a woman representing social services (Tilda Swinton), who wants to have Sam committed. She seems to represent the menace of the mainland, where people do things differently than on the friendly, laid back island.

I love the period touches -Suzy's minidresses and blue eye shadow, record player, and less neurotic, simpler, dispositions in general. But "Moonrise Kingdom" is not a period film. Anderson uses 1960s motifs when it suits him and anachronisms just as easily. Sam and Suzy are more romantically sophisticated than sheltered middle class kids were before the internet. Suzy's parents are both lawyers, which leaves me to wonder who takes care of her three little brothers if her mother works long hours. There were not many female lawyers in the 1960s, much less with young children. The couple is also old to have children that age by the standards of their generation. It's Wes Anderson's whimsical universe, not 1960s America.

I live in a relatively smaller city, and since Moonrise Kingdom was never put into general release, I would never have seen it except for a chance opportunity while visiting my daughter in Chicago last summer.  I had never heard of it, and wasn't even that excited about seeing it, since I'd never seen any advertising or a trailer for it.  My mistake!  While a movie that is loaded with stars doesn't always guarantee an excellent movie, this movie delivers!  Bill Murray, Bruce Willis, Ed Norton, Frances McDormand, Tilda Swinton, Harvey Keitel and all the various young newcomers featured, all deliver amazing performances.  This is a really "quirky" movie with characters who are all dysfunctional in some way, but you will laugh and cry, and after watching it will say, "that is the best movie I've seen in a long time!"  I just bought the DVD for each of my adult kids as a stocking stuffer because I want them to have the opportunity to see it and enjoy it as much as I did.  You won't be disappointed!
Just boring. Turned it off because we couldn't get into it. Expected more from such top actors. Wish I could get my money back.
DVD was purchased for a gift. I have not seen this movie therefore I cannot rate it one way or the other. DVD arrived to me as scheduled and was otherwise not defective.

I rented this film because it featured several of my favorite actors - Bruce Willis, Edward Norton, Bill Murray, Frances McDormand.

It turned out to be a colossal waste of talent. The basic plot - two pre-teen kids run away when they fall into mindless infatuation - could have been interesting, but the screenplay fell far short of the basic premise and the two lead child actors were simply awful.  Could-not-act.  Truly painful to watch.

As for Anderson's directing, he doesn't seem to know whether he wants to be John Waters or a kiddie-porn anime director.  How this film ever garnered enthusiastic reviews simply befuddles me.
I enjoyed this movie, it was entertaining but a little too juvenile for my taste. Great movie for young teens.
I would not have wasted my money if I had known how bad it was. There were a lot of good actors, but the story was aweful!

If you like films that are a little off the wall yet Norman Rockwell like with a dash of small town humor, you'll appreciate this film and want to watch it more than once.  Not your typical "coming of age" film though definitely approaching the subject in a sweet and innocent manner as opposed to the dime a dozen "American Pie" movies out there.  A must see for all.
Not just a kid flick, entertaining for adults, too.  A good break from typical Hollywood all explosion & violence fare.
This movie is sure to become a cult classic. Quirky and very original characters and story. Kind of movie that grows on you.

I watched this movie with my dad a few days ago and we both absolutely loved it. I was so shocked that my dad did, because he is a tough critic, and he absolutely adored it. So this is my Christmas gift to him, and I totally recommend it. It was done in such a wonderful, unique way and such an adorable story. Awesome awesome awesome.

Oh, and Amazon gave it to me free on my computer as a rental! I was so surprised :)
To anyone that likes Sundance movies.  This one is top totch.  The filming style and narrating and all.  Great movie.
This is the most amazing movie I've seen in years. Absolutely phenomenal acting. True love portrayed wonderfully between Sam and Suzy. My Review 5 STARS!

Watched this movie with a smile on my face the whole time! Sweet story and characters that are more real than whats in most movies.
Only one part that may be a little risky for my 13 year old grand-daughter. Opens the door for a good talk though.
This movie is so wonderful. Quirky yet refined and excellently written. Everything you'd expect from Wes Anderson and the casts he compiles!

'Moonrise Kingdom' has the same look and feel as Wes Anderson other films; festive colors, hilarious dialogue, and brilliant actors come together to create a moving story. A perfect movie for people of all ages, plenty of laughs and a great story about love, personal discovery, and exploration. Highly recommended.
Once again, Wes Anderson treats his audience to beautiful storytelling around characters who will make you laugh while they break your heart.

Very fun and imaginative, surprising, quirky inventive cinematography. Overall I finish this movie happy to see what movies are like when the creators just allow themselves to be  creative, odd and just have some fun with it.

The story of a boy and a girl coming of age, that's bizarre to the max. With a star studded cast I expected something quite different. The film is shot in what I can only refer to as a "choppy style." The characters are all strange and difficult to relate to. The only reason I gave it 2 stars instead of one, was because it was partially filmed in Rhode Island. That was it's only appeal.
Well filmed. Great story.  I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys a unique and fun move.  Great for adults and teens.
I would not recommend this for children. We enjoyed it overall, but would not recommend to anyone other than for them to watch on a whim.

I thought this movie might be fun because of all the well known actors.
Is wasn't.  Just stupid.  Find another movie and don't waste your time.

We kept thinking that, with this cast, the movie had to get more interesting.  It didn't.

I figure a bunch of actors wanted to have some fun making a movie and didn't care if it was interesting.

All the deliveries were deadpan. What plot there was was stupid.  They found the kids described in the summary about 30% into the movie.
Not at all what we expected, it is a weird spoof. No-one in this movie is "normal". It is a mystery why there were big names in this movie.
The price was good and it arrived quickly.  The combo pack with blu-ray and dvd plus the digital copy is always great, you can watch you movie anywhere.

If you have never seen a Wes Anderson film before, you might not like this movie. His films are always off-kilter and have interesting, strange characters and plots.

Excellent visually and the score is great. Bruce Willis is fantastic.

Perfect video streaming from Amazon
Movie was a nice family film with wholeheartedly healthy morals. I'm glad that I waited to watch online.
I fell asleep about halfway through while watching it !  I thought it would be better based on the other reviews

This movie probably isn't for everyone, but it has a unique sense of humor and an excellent visual style that is very endearing. I personally was not a fan of director Wes Anderson's well known film The Royal Tanenbaums, but this movie far surpasses Tanenbaums in almost every way. The acting is excellent all around, especially Edward Norton, Bruce Willis and the 2 kids who play the lead roles. If you're in the mood for something a little different, this movie is for you.

watched this movie last night,  wasn't quite sure about it based on just the title of the movie alone, never knew about it before last night either..  granted it seemed there was alot of mono tone voice and dry humor but in the end I found it to be an enjoyable movie with some funny parts yes despite what others here said about it.

Weaker than Life Aquatic but acceptable if you enjoy this particular genre. It is all promise: I like the premises of the show, and continue hoping it will be a good ''installment''. It is not, but you will watch it because the style builds a certain loyalty. I like Bill Murray a lot, yet his part is minor and essentially not much in character. It's like saying, give some stars, because I still want Wes Anderson to make movies like that, only better.

I've always been a fan of Wes Anderson's movies, but Moonrise Kingdom really pulls all the elements together -- the quirky characters, the offbeat humor, the fascination with dysfunctional family dynamics -- and adds an extra dose of sweetness and optimism about the human capacity for love. It's also gorgeous to look at and has a great soundtrack. Superb!

Moonrise Kingdom is one of the best films I have seen in recent years. It is imaginative, creative and simply beautiful. The film was very highly recommended by both our (adult) daughters, and  I agree!!!!!
Watched it with my 11 year old son, who also was enchanted by it. Interesting bridge between Anderson's more adult and more child-centric films.

I thought it was an excellent movie. Didn't quite know what to expect, as reviews were not exactly descriptive. A movie that shows characters who don't fit the mold, how people need to really, REALLY learn that people are unique, and develop behaviors that embrace the differences in all. Good for families to teach their kids to view differences in friends and others as OK, as a learning experience, and something to broaden their perspective. Some parents may not like the friendship that develops between the two main characters, especially if they have children in that pre-teen age range, but also to see that what adults may view as wrong, is to give too much "shame" to something that children don't quite have the knowledge of.

I came of age with Rushmore and Royal Tenenbaums.  Now, 15 years later, I feel like Wes has almost become a parody of himself.  There's just not much evolution in his work.  Everything is so precious, the kids are precocious, and a whole cast of extremely talented adult actors are underutilized.  If you are expecting Rushmore caliber Bill Murray, look elsewhere.  More broadly, I think my issue was a lack of a engaging story.  Off to catch the bus...in slow motion...set to a 60's era punk song.
Movie chosen because of the great actors but they must have really been hard up for work to do this movie

I gave this movie only two stars but it is the service that earned the stars not the movie.  I never got to see the movie....I rented it for my wife and i to watch but we never got the chance....The rental was removed because there is a set amount of time Amazon will wait before taking your money and not let you watch it.  I think it the time from is 2 weeks.....not sure why they limit that...if I paid the money let it sit in my library until i get the chance to watch.

never will rent a money until we sit down to start watching it.....

Wes Anderson movies always hit it out of the park. This movie takes us all back in time to the first person we fell in love with.  Great performances by Bruce Willis, Fancis McDormat, Edward Norton, and Anderson stalwart Bill Murray. The kids are really the stars of the show and you will fall for them within the first 10 minutes. Great show!
Not as interesting as his other movies. Watchable if you like his movies. My friends liked it more than I did.
This movie was an interesting look in the minds of two children who have their own inner struggles they must overcome. It's cute.

I was a child in the '60's, and the details and cinematography of this film were excellent.  They really capture the time.  Absolutely beautiful photography; I wish I had seen it on big screen in the theater.
 A heads up to parents -- there is a short scene midway through the movie where the 12 year olds are French-kissing in their underwear, and discussing their private parts.
This was a strange but interesting plot for a movie.  It inevitably leaves you feeling good after many opportunties for disaster.
The only thing I enjoyed was the location shots - since much of it was filmed in Rhode Island - not new Zealand!! The plot was ridiculis and not even funny. I was so glad when it was finally over!

My favorite Wes Anderson movie. Loved the characters, the setting, and the 2 kids were great
My favorite Movie of last summer

If you like other films from this director, like Royal Tenenbaums or The Life Aquatic, you'll also love this film.  It takes the hyper stylized quality of Life Aquatic and ramps it up to another, stranger level.  It also reminds me of the style in I Heart Huckabees.  The characters are genuinely interesting and the story is surprising.

I gave this movie 5 stars because it was so engaging. The acting was spot on for this somewhat silly movie that spoke about pursuing your dream no matter what others might think. I highly recommend it.
What a strange movie. Not bad, how could it be with all these great actors?! It was deffinitely different though.
Never seen anything like this movie. It's great! It's hilarious and the color scheme in the movie blew my mind.

This movie is a feel good, nostalgic walk down memory lane, whenever your childhood, wherever summers were spent, this movie brings it all back. Great cast and setting, I will watch it again and again.

This movie is one of those gems you stumble upon that is so well thought out, so superbly cast, so fun to watch and a delight to the movie watching experience that you wish it would never end.  This is how movies should be made.  Charming and a must see for real movie enthusiasts.
Moonrise Kingdom was not interesting to me in any way. It could not keep my attention. I fell asleep out of boredom.
This was such a sweet and funny movie. It was pretty consistent with the style of Wes Anderson's other films, and was definitely just as enjoyable.

If you love Wes Anderson or just any delightfully awkward film that takes place in the sixties then this is for you. It is truly amazing and appeals to many. Even though it features young kids it is not appropriate for young kids. It has the PG-13 rate mark... but this is a film that I laughed out loud in, felt awkward watching, but was really glad to have experienced it in the end. A great movie!
A well done heart warming store.  The look, the acting, the direction, so much said unspoken. This was a lovely and lovingly made film.
This movie has so many layers to it and describes a world that never existed . . . but I wish it did.
I did not like the part when the little dog died.  The movie could have done without that. But a really great movie overall.

A very touching story of young love, first love really. Although the two adolescents are quirky and don't set the best example, they seem to be very compatible. And, their adventures are quite entertaining. Excellent casting on both the stars, but also the extensive supporting cast.

This movie is hilarious, and, if you like Wes Anderson, you will love it.  I'd rank this with Rushmore and Fantastic Mr. Fox as his best.  Great performances by everyone, but the kids steal the show, especially Jared Gilman.

Wes Anderson does it again. A super cute movie about teenage love. The styling of the movie is
fun enough to watch on its owen. You will enjoy every minute.
You can't go wrong with a Wes Anderson movie and Moonrise Kingdom doesn't disappoint. Bill Murray could have had a bigger role, bit it's a great movie nonetheless.

The young boy, one of the main characters, had a terrible speaking voice.  It got harder and harder to listen to him. The acting was wooden.  I like many of the actors in this film and kept hoping it would get better.  It didn't.

Brilliant? Miraculous? Nonsense. This movie is a complete waste of time and I wish I had my hour and a half back--which actually felt like about four hours. These kids could not act their ways out of a paper bag. Everything that is wrong with the movie industry today--right there for your viewing. Ugh. Save yourself the pain of having to sit thought this one.
A wonderful and delightful summertime film. Filled with the innocence of youth, the quirks and flaws of adults, the feel of summer camp with drama and heart. Not to be missed.
Bizarre premise, strange acting, someone was on drugs when they wrote this one.  A waste of good actors' abilities.  A cross between Tim Burton and Clockwork Orange.

Great film about young love, family, death, and most of all adventure. The main characters were written perfectly with their own strange issues and lovable qualities. Wonderful cast with some of my favorite actors.

Looks great. Was a lot of fun. Feels like a culmination of the style
presente in all the others. Good date movie.

I don't understand why so many people who previously disliked Wes Anderson like this movie, for me it is one of his least successful efforts - actually not unlike one of those skits where kids read the lines from presidential debates, or maybe one of those ads where toddlers speak like adults.  Here all the action is with two children, who mouth words that are clearly coming from an adult (and hipster) mind. Painfully boring and unoriginal.

I don't think I can add any more to the splendid reviews of this movie, but I loved it from the very beginning to the end.  I felt as if I were witnessing a Norman Rockwell series of paintings come alive.  The photography, acting, direction, casting, musical score and story were wonderful. I would give it best movie of the year.
It's kind of a quirky movie with a great cast.  Definitely strays from the mainstream formula movies, but is entertaining and worth seeing.
I liked it It was a lot of fun , I think most young men fantasise about running away to the woods: even better with a cute girl.
The quality of the movie was bad, a lot of digital breakup although it was supposed to be full HD and we have all of the required hardware for that. The movie itself did not appeal to me, either.

This film is the one where it all comes together. The ambiance, the soundtrack, solid ensemble acting all around the board, the off kilter Anderson dialogue - and the perfect chapterlike directing by Anderson. He put his experience with Mr. Fox to use here but doesn't sacrifice some of the occasional "brutish reality " aspects present in most other Anderson films. Moonrise Kingdom is the one that pushes Anderson over the edge from excellent director to iconic director. Highest recommendation!
Fabulous, funny, fantastic movie! If you are a child of the 60's, you will love this movie. Everyone is fabulous!

thier is fun plots to this movie and it will get boring if you are not expecting the 60's era  but is has some good parts to it and you want watch with the kids and show/tell them about this era if you can get past some of the boring parts

I am a Wes Anderson fan to begin with.  But this movie in its own right is great.  There is a simplicity and innocence to it all on the face, but some much deeper underlying themes to explore about the human condition.
We love this show! We haven't laughed this hard in a movie for a long time. Everyone must see it

I chose this movie because it was clear through even the previews, to be humorous, yet serious- and I love that.
It surpassed my expectations and I truly enjoy watching every minute of this film.
The actors are good? but the scenes are quite boring. The music is boring, 90% of the scenes are boring quite unreal and stupid.

This movie like all of Wes Anderson's films was exceptional and really a great watch. It's simple and very cute story of two young teenagers in love and along with it a lot of quirky and hilarious cast.

The perfect Wes Anderson movie. All of his aesthetic flourishes come together elegantly in this hilarious movie. If you don't like watching adolescents and adults speaking in wry deadpan as they go about their quirky adventures, stay far, far away. If that description instead appeals to you, then by all means click "play" now.
I really enjoyed this movie, it has some big names but comes off as an indie style movie. Finally something different from Hollywood.
Wes Anderson's best.  By far.  The out-of-nowhere stars are amazing, and the film is stylized just enough that the kitschiness doesn't overwhelm the story.
Really great cast.  Cute story.  Artfully done and beautiful scenery.  Will have to put this on the "need to own list."

Two strange kids falling in love theme made an over rated movie in my view.  The movie "Deep Impact" made better use of this theme as well as weaving a more complex and exciting story line.  The quirky kids and strange parents in Moonrise Kingdom just barely held my interest.  This is an old story going back to the times of Romeo and Juliet, Like Shakespere, you could also call this a tragedy only from an entertainment standpoint.
A little "out there" for me. Love the cast though. Rented it since it was filmed in my town. The feel of the movie was awkward.

One of my favorite movies in years. Wes Anderson's magical thinking is unapologetically on display here, but the most remarkable thing about this movie is how deeply it understands the experience of being 12, and combines both a child's and an adult's understanding. As for the product, I was a little disappointed with how few extras there were on the disc and not much printed material. The fact that it shows up with a zillion formats is interesting but mainly useful for people who want to play it at home, in the car, on the iPad, and on the computer all at once (meaning, I suppose, lots of kids) and that's not my situation. So even though I love the film it's a little hard to justify $25 without more extras.
I loved the characters! A trip down memory lane. The roles were made for the actors. A must see movie!
Odd group to some but good acting, good story, and just like reality for those that have to live with the odd. Great movie.
Almost surreal...children talking like perfect adults, adults accepting children's reality...funky little story with good actors.  Not as weird as Tim Burton, but almost!

Love this movie and love Wes Anderson. He's not afraid to take chances and is subtly funny in his writing and directing. Definitely not a movie for everyone but anyone who can appreciate unformulaic movies will love this one, pulled off by a GREAT cast!

Quirky little comedy that explores the problems of not fitting in and how two young people find their way. In spite of the dead pan line delivery and implausible events, I found myself caring about one happened to the characters. Watching it a second time I saw a lot of small details that added to the depth of the characters.

Gotta give some respect to these wonderful young actors. They hold the screen with just as much emotion and quirkiness as the icons they share it with (Frances McDormand, Bill Murray, Bruce Willis, Ed Norton, just to name a few...). I'm sorta addicted to Anderson's stylistic flourishes that reside somewhere between heartfelt memory and satire of youth. The film's characters sorta left a "Catcher in the Rye" flavor in my mouth, but I really can't explain why. That's the best part of Anderson's films for me. They leave me with something powerful, and I can never really say how or why....

The sign of a true auteur is that their style becomes their artistic strength. I'm a fan of Wes Anderson's style, certainly--he had me at "Rushmore", a movie that touched me by reminding me just how joyous it was to have the boundless but immature ambition of my youth. But as much as I love his quirks, they've never before congealed into the cohesive artistic vision that "Moonrise Kingdom" presents. In the manner that Woody Allen made many great urbane comedies before his cinematic skills (and collaborators) finally caught up with his ambitions, Anderson has made quirky, fun movies that have indulged and defined his peculiar aesthetic. But "Moonlight Kingdom" puts him in rare air indeed, where his creation is not merely quirky by nature--but damned if it isn't quirkiness distilled to its very essence--no longer the color, but the actual substance of his art.

Masters like Fellini, Altman, Hitchcock, and Scorcese produce their greatest films not by inhibiting their visions, but indulging them--the more Fellini is being Fellini, the more exciting his creation. I think making his first animated film, "The Fantastic Mr. Fox", liberated Wes Anderson's artistic muse--and now that it's been unleashed on the medium of live action, his weirdness becomes even more weird, and all the more wonderful. This film is more Wes Andersonesque than any of his previous films, relentlessly so. But the plot, the cast, the music, the sets, and the scenery are all in tune this time--in the same manner that the Gershwin music, luscious black-and-white cinematography, and iconic New York landscape contributed so mightily to Woody Allen's masterpiece.

It seems that the more Wes Anderson is himself, the greater his movies become. I dearly hope he can continue to make movies of this artistic standard--because I'm very excited by both his vision, and his fidelity to it.

Moonrise Kingdom is a sweetheart of a movie that touches one's heart no matter what age. It's a love story between two, just barely into their teens, young boy and girl. It's a bit like Romeo and Juliette and also involves family and their  young  fellow contemporaries. There's nothing like your first love, especially when you're a teen, you just never forget it. Of course the fun also comes from seeing how the grownups handle it. Ace actors like Bruce Willis, Frances McDormand, Bill Murray and Edward Norton give wonderfully touching performances as the befuddled adults. It's one of the best coming of age movies in recent times.
This movie is not for everyone,  but the thought it was hilarious.  Parents loved it as well.  Not a Rushmore fan, but like liked Life Aquatic.
i had to watch this more than once to get it. because it's different, which is rare and delightful. I recommend this movie

Moonrise Kingdom is a great movie. The artistry and precision of the scenes constructed by Wes Anderson have always been fantastic. The low quality of the image in the streaming Amazon video were disappointing and distracted from the movie significantly. I won't likely make future purchases.
This movie was highly recommended, so I was kind of waiting for something fascinating or beautiful to happen.  It only kind of did.  Good compared to a lot of movies, though!

Wes Anderson's films are an acquired taste.
From "Rushmore", "Bottle Rocket" to "Royal Tannenbaum", "Darjeeling Limited" and "Life Aquatic", I've seen most of his
films with the exception "Mr. Fox". I've got similar impressions after watching each of his films, light, quirky(including the names of the films), colorful with not much of a story and did not leave much impressions afterwards.
This film is no exception.  It has great production design, engaging actors, some from top drawers, colorful and quirky
but it is so light that did not make a good movie watching experience, for me.  It was like reading a comic book for children.  Love him, or dislike him, Wes Anderson.

This quirky, sometimes goofy young romance tale focuses upon a small island community in the 1960s which is so idyllic that it probably never existed. Minor annoyances turn into big crisis which gets the whole community involved at times and several of the characters have deadpan deliveries which reminds you this is a film by Wes Anderson. In fact, the case that the actors are not pushing for laughs adds to the quality of this picture.

Tale focuses upon an insular community which boils its problems over as an impending disaster flood hits the community. Our big "crisis" however is between two young lovers  (12 year old Sam and Suzy, who seems to be close to him in age) who fall in love, become pen-pals, agree to run away together and name their secret cove "The Moonrise Kingdom" (influenced by the fantasy books read by the girl). Did I mention both of these kids are socially maladjusted and might have some issues upon reaching adulthood? Look for how Suzy uses those scissors, people. Ouch.

Anyway . . .

The child actors (played by Jared Gilman and Kara Hayward) are up to the task of matching the impressive ensemble cast (one could argue they are a supporting cast): a subdued Bruce Willis, Bill Murray as his usual melancholy self, Frances McDormand, Ed Norton as a Dudley Do Right Cub Scout leader, Jason Schwartzman in a conniving role, Harvey Keitel in a small supporting role and Tilda Swinton (is she wearing a red wig?) as the ominous "Social Services". The fellow cub scouts to the Sam character had some characters of their own, too.

Gotham Awards has currently nominated this feature for "Best Picture" and "Best Ensemble Performance". The budget was $16M for this feature and so far it made a bit over $65M at the Box Office.

CINEMATOGRAPHY: A minus; STORY/PLOTTING/EDITING: B to B plus; CHARACTERS/DIALOGUE: B plus to A minus; THEME DELIVERIES: B plus to A minus; OVERALL GRADE: B plus to A minus; WHEN WATCHED: mid November 2012.
Beautiful, funny, and soulful.  Visually a work of art.  Classic.  I would like to add this movie to my collection.  Loved it!
Loved it! Nothing compares to the Royal Tenanbaums (sp?), but this was pretty darn close! Much better than Life Aquatic....

I like the main actors in this movie and had seen the trailer. It looked interesting but I found it a little weird. I'm having trouble classifying this movie. Is it about family dynamics, coming of age, or both? I liked Bruce Willis in his role because I could relate to his personal conflicts. But the other characters were really way out there. And I have to say the lead girl and boy were very strange. Really, children getting married and for what purpose? I would rate this movie 3 stars mostly because of the wonderful job the camera man (woman?) did. The scenery is beautiful.
A very odd, somewhat pointless ramble through a phase out of two children's lives. At times funny, but mostly not.
I very much enjoyed the dynamic between the lead children liked the way the adult leads let them own the film.

Moonrise Kingdom is a very imaginative and well written movie that despite the writers attempts I think is a "feel good" movie overall. I was hoping that Bill Murray would have a larger comedic role in the movie but he was not the focus of the film at all. Great movie, great comedy and a great overall message. It really makes me miss the good ol days and gives people some prospective.
Really cute and deep film.  Thoroughly enjoyed it.  Thought provoking. Reminds me of my childhood at certain points in the movie

I watched this on my tv via hdmi through my macbook. The only resolution available was low-quality and very pixelated. Excellent movie, I really enjoyed it. However, having paid $3.99 to rent it for 24 hrs seems very steep considering the quality, I assure you it was not my connection.
As I stated above, the movie was excellent about 90 percent of the time. I had a few issues with some things that happened at the end, but overall a great movie with awesome music.
I am aware that there are people that are less than enthusiastic about Wes Anderson and his work. Those people are wrong.

If you are a fan of Wes Anderson (as I am), you pretty much know what to expect from his films by now.  Beautifully staged and obsessively detailed sets and cinematography, great music, quirky storylines about underdogs who don't quite fit into society... and characters whose main defining trait is usually a deep and pervasive melancholy.

In all these respects, Moonrise Kingdom is a "typical" Wes Anderson film.  However I don't think it quite lives up to his classics like Rushmore or The Royal Tenebaums.  The performances are excellent.  Many of Anderson's usual cast of players return, including Bill Murray and Jason Schwartzman.  Edward Norton is hilarious as the scout troop leader who takes his responsibilities a bit too seriously.

But this film really belongs to its 2 young stars, Jared Gilman as Sam and Kara Hayward as Suzy.  Both of them are excellent in their roles, although they are somewhat boxed in by Anderson's usual tendency of having his characters display very little emotion, or much enthusiasm for anything.  In a story about young first love, it would be nice if the 2 young people at least seemed a LITTLE bit excited about finding romance and a kindred spirit.  The flat affect does make the kids seem wise beyond their years, and it hints at the sadness that both have experienced - but I also think it detracts somewhat from the excitement and rush of that first adolescent romance.

Like all Wes Anderson films, this one is enjoyable and fun to watch.  The supporting cast is excellent especially Norton, and also Bruce Willis playing against type as a quiet and lonely bachelor who ends up caring about Sam.  While not up there with Anderson's classics, it is still enjoyable and worth watching.

This film is funny and poignant.  It almost feels like Wes Anderson wrote himself into the story.  Find your inner child and celebrate along with the main characters as they seek their slice of freedom.  Well written, well acted and well directed.

There is no easy way to describe this film.  A mixture of serious and the absurd.

It's the serious that makes you love the characters, and empathize with their situation.

It's the absurd that makes you laugh in the midst of very serious subject matter.

I will say, that while the director does a fantastic job bringing the pieces together, the actors do an equally fantastic job.  The two lead kids perfectly convey being both wise, yet terribly nave.  The big name actors are almost invisible.  By invisible, I mean you don't see Bruce Willis and say, hey, that's Bruce Willis.  You see the character instead.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Edward Norton was equally impressive with his character mind meld.

Overall, a very enjoyable film.
this was a great change of pace movie that was funny and had us laughing throughout.  I can't understand why this movie wasn't giving more advertizing because it's well worth the viewing.
My husband and I enjoyed this movie very much. A funny story about people and the strange ways they behave.

Totally winning addition to the oddball collection of Wes Anderson films, each of which hits the bullseye in exotic ways.  Very much like prime Robert Altman, his films seems to wallow in  oddball collections of wacky characters with sometimes overly familiar actors doing dazzlingly unconventional work bringing them to life.  This is story of a pre-adolescent nerd doing a wildly romantic thing, kidnapping a young girl and running off to escape a hostile world. It is totally absurd, and is played, very much from the viewpoint of his character's warped pubescent  viewpoint.  His actions cause a major upheaval in the 1960s scout camp environment. Everyone is in dead earnest to get things back to normalcy. Edward Norton is his immediate scoutmaster, Bruce Willis is a cop trying to communicate with him, and Bill Murray and Frances McDormand are his parents. And Harvey Keitel, in an unbilled cameo, is the grand poo-bah of scout camps. Each of them are completely delightful in their roles, unlike any of their previous appearances in other films. A one-of -a-kind.
lots of visual links to other great movies including scenes we have all live thru, in one form or another. true love when you are 12 is a magnificent thing.

This is one of my new favorite movies! I LOVED the quirky sense of humor, the cinematography, the simple, poignant love story. Every scene and line could be thought about and carried symbolism to  something much broader, deeper, and universal. I especially loved the sincerity and honesty between the two main characters and how that forms the basis for true love in any relationship. I enjoyed each character in the film and thought they were perfectly cast. My favorite line: "I'm on your side." Brilliant!

A very entertaining story. It was funny and heart warming all at the same time. The actors really played their parts well.

If you liked Rushmore, The Royal Tenenbaums, Bottle Rocket, The Life Aquatic, and The Darjeeling Limited, then you'll love this movie.  Wes Anderson has a way of taking you into the quirky worlds of his characters.  The plot involves two young people, who decide to run away together, and form their own society.  The rest of the movie involves the parents and other interested parties trying to find them.  The actors who play the young boy and girl, are relative unknowns, but they give great performances for first timers.  Also, strong performances by Edward Norton, Frances McDormand, Bill Murray(always great), and Bruce Willis make this a must see for Wes Anderson fans.
Instantly became a favourite of mine. Great acting, great plot, great characters. Love the cast!!! Outstanding movie! Would highly recommend.

Wish I hadn't been such a cynic as a kid, dropping out of Girl Scouts right after crossing the ceremonial bridge from Brownies; the events played out as serious in this film are completely charming.  A really funny trip down certain memory lanes.  Lots of wonderful, laugh out loud moments.  Wes Anderson was a former philosophy major according to IMDB--and look!  There really are places in the world for this background.

"Moonrise Kingdom" opened to mixed reviews, but yours truly finds it to be a thoroughly enjoyable and entertaining look at life and love as seen through the eyes of two "troubled" preteens. Sam and Susie, the youngsters at the heart of this film, are a bit like Bonnie and Clyde. They're both a bit antisocial and they both unleash a storm of trouble--often without intending to. Their form of rebellion starts out innocently enough when they decide to run away together. They are, in effect, eloping. Sam, an orphan, is trying to break away from all the foster families that just don't understand him. And Susie, who lives with her mother, father and three brothers, is trying to enter some kind of fantasy world like the ones in the books she reads. She, too, is often misunderstood, but in Susie's case it's largely her own fault for embracing and expressing ideas that are [deliberately] alienating to those of her parents and siblings. Sam, on the other hand, seems genuinely to dance to the beat of his own drummer. If Susie is something of a poseur, Sam is unabashedly eccentric! Well, after hooking up and hiking out (they live on an island and, Sam, a Khaki Scout, wants to retrace the steps of a Native American tribe's so-called "Harvest Trail"), they are pursued by everyone and everything they're trying to leave behind--a troop of scouts, the local police, Susie's parents, a social worker and their own prelapsarian states of mind. It isn't long before they realize that, while there's no Garden of Eden for them anywhere on the island, one's home isn't entirely in one's head, either. There's a trade-off that has to be made between living one's dreams and sharing a life with all the other misfits and crazies who co-inhabit the entirely too physical reality over which none of us has any more control than we do our own thoughts and feelings!
This movie was simple and odd. I don't think i will ever watch it again. Just not super fantastic. Interesting cinematography and good acting.
just such a bad movie... don't waste your time watching this.  The acting was bad, the story-line was inane and it tried too hard to be indy and cool, but it just pissed the mark altogether.

Excellent movie and one which thankfully strays well out of the mainstream story of typical hollywood scripts these days. A story worth telling and participating in as a viewer

This movie is a fun and witty portrayal of the emotions and struggles associated with middle childhood. While the movie has a big-named cast, all of whom do a wonderful job, the two lead children are the center of attention and their acting is incredible. If you're a Wes Anderson fan, you'll probably love this movie, and if you're not familiar with his work, it is a great way to introduce yourself to his films.

Wes Anderson certainly uses the cinematographic medium to its full advantage in this wonderfully creative film about adolescent love. Even though the story is your basic 'boy meets girl', Anderson's attention to detail and nuance balanced with deadpan humor and sight gags make this movie a delight to watch. Unpredictable at times, formulaic at others, it is a visual and auditory treat. The underpinning of the entire film is Benjamin Britten's "The Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra" (a brilliant choice!) Even though the story takes place in 1965, don't expect any traditional 'Top 40 Hits' of that era -  Anderson is much too eclectic for that. This isn't necessarily a profound cinematic experience - but it is an entertaining, eccentric, funny, touching, and a visually and musically arresting one. (Rated PG-13 for 'sexuality and smoking'??? Come on, they were only kissing, and the girl was in her undergarments. But the PG-13 rating shows just how ridiculously prudish America and the MPAA have become.)

Sweet, odd story. Big-name actors in a little-publicized movie. That tells you something about the quality of the film. Endearing. If you liked the TV series "Pushing Daisies" you might like this. Similar visual effects.

Wow, some of the people on Amazon are just ridiculous. This is another great film from Anderson. He really hasn't had a misstep just different tones and ideas that some like more than the others. It's pretty hard to rank his films to be honest as they are all pretty damn good. This one has a great theme of childhood exploration and satisfies for me the remembrance of an innocent time long past. This one really singles in on some personal stuff if you get it but I would imagine a lot of people won't have a clue and maybe that is for the better. The directing is astute and creative as always and the acting from all involved fits the film perfectly. The romance between the two kids is sweet and subtle. People who are calling it awkward or lewd are friggin' amazingly daft. The whole point of the story revolves around childhood love and imagination. I give it the full five stars. Wes is clearly a very talented guy and I look forward to each film he puts out. Please stop expecting this guy to make some kind of melodramatic cringe-inducing drama because that is simply not the kind of stuff this guy does.

Story line and characters were unusually interesting.
Was a little disturbed over seeing a young girl dressed scantily and in a sexual manner, as well as 2 young people engaged in something they knew nothing of.
One of my favourite Anderson-directed films; eccentric, colourful, and clever. I heartily recommend it. A 10/10; would definitely watch again.

An orphaned 12 year old boy scout in 1965 and the 12 year year old girl he falls innocently in love with... Wonderful cast, great script, incredibly evocative, great direction, beautifully shot; Wes Anderson's best film so far.
This was one crazy story line, and quite a feat to untangle. It was crazy, but very good, we thought!

Despite all of the positive ratings, I wasn't too impressed with this one. Director Wes Anderson frames his takes like works of art -- each scene carefully set. However, the script by Anderson and Roman Coppola does not dazzle like "The Royal Tenenbaums (The Criterion Collection),Rushmore (The Criterion Collection), or Bottle Rocket (The Criterion Collection), where those films characters are memorable and liven up the story and screen. This film falls more in the same category with Anderson's lackluster films The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou (The Criterion Collection) and The Darjeeling Limited (The Criterion Collection) -- films that are too artistic as well as lack any emotion in dialogue or acting. I loved the previous three and Fantastic Mr. Fox (Ws), but this one contains not much that is memorable (including the two leads, Jared Gilman and Kara Hayward). Veteran actors like Bill Murray, Frances McDormand and Harvey Keitel are wasted. The true standouts of the film are the Khaki Scout troop 55 boys; they had some of the best parts in the film. I think Anderson should re-team up with Owen Wilson on writing duties since his best work ("Tenenbaums," "Rushmore," "Bottle Rocket") has been with him. Lately, Anderson seems more style than substance and while his films look great, it doesn't make them memorable for why they should be: for being a well-written, well-performed film.
This movie is visual perfection. Every single shot is a feast. The color quality is beautiful. I really enjoyed the quirky story and characters. This is in my top ten list.

This is truly a beautiful movie.  A quirky town and even stranger family, but a touching plot.  The boy and girl, definitely misfits, find their way through it all to a mutual happiness.  (sorry if that's a spoiler, but the trip is more than worth it).
Another good one from Wes Anderson! Great story, characters, humor and heart. It's difficult not to be a fan of his movies.
Loved it,A great story and the leeds were excellent. Very humorous and heartfelt. It took me back to my youth,It had a joyous feeling and was alot of fun

What a fun movie!  Wes Anderson, director of one of my favs The Royal Tenenbaums, puts together another great movie with exceptional performances from Edward Norton, Bruce Willis, Bill Murray and Frances McDormand.  Not to mention the two lead kids, who really bring the innocence of the times to life.  :-)

This movie was not at all what I was hoping for and the uncomfortable love scene between the two main players made me look away. They were way too young and it was awkward and unnecessary. I really wanted to turn it off. Disliked it a lot.
Great movie if you like Wes Anderson's films. Good stuff. I would recommend the movie and I will never rent a DVD again after streaming the film for the first time.
what really is needed to enjoy this flick is your basic bowl of fresh popcorn and a cold fizzy soda.  otherwise delectable on its own.
The movie was great!  Watched it on my Kindal in New Zealand in our hotel room.  No glitches.  It downloaded just fine!  Thanks.
I had never heard of this movie, but trailer looked interesting.  Turned out to be a GREAT quirky film!  Don't know why it wasn't a bigger hit!

Absolutely loved the humor and characters in this movie.  From the trailer that lured me in, to the ending, I was entertained.  Well written, casted and directed.  I give it 5 stars.  One of a kind type of flick.

Good story line but the movie itself wasn't that great. With all of my favorite actors I was expecting something awesome. The background Music was suspenseful the whole time leading up to nothing. Eh.
Moonrise Kingdom is a delightful, whimsical, sweet film. The cast is full of real pros, and the off-kilter laughs are sprinkled throughout. Watch it more than once, it gets deeper each time.

Pretty typical Wes Anderson. The characters are very good ( the actors too) and hard to believe the young leads are only 12! Makes you stop to think about how we behave as adults with our children and is packed with subtle yet truly Wes scenes. Very highly recommended.

So i bought this DVD, without even seeing the movie, only the trailer. I saw that 96% of critics loved the movie, so i just had to get it.( i also heard from friends that it was good). Let me tell you, i watched this with my mom, and dad who i convinced to wacth cause bill murray, bruce willis, and Edward Norton were in it. At first they thought it was a strange movie, but i thought it was amazing. Well done, and worth the $15. This is one of the best movies i have ever seen. The music is well done in the movie, and the actors are perfect. I will be watching this movie for years to come, and would highly reccomend it to any movie or film lover. It has some really funny moments, and ever scene is well done. GO BUY!
I couldn't recommend this more. Just watch it. Bruce Willis, Edward Norton and Bill Murray make for a wonderful trio.

This made my top 10 list of worst movies ever created, and I would give it zero stars if Amazon allowed it. It got great reviews on Rotten Tomatoes, and I have no earthly idea why. The plot was slow and pointless.

We fast-forwarded to the ending just out of sheer morbid curiosity. What a train wreck. If I had purchased the physical DVD I would use it for target practice. There goes 90 minutes of my life I can never get back.
Very strange concept for a movie, but the stars pull it off and the non-stars made it an enjoyable experience!
Moonrise Kingdom is an Entertaining film, I didn't love it, but I enjoyed.  It's Probably worth your time if you liked Wes Anderson's other films.
Great movie!  The story and cinematography captured my attention.  Gorgeous natural scenery and thoughtfully chosen music really made this movie stand out.
Great great film everyone should see it fantastic from start to finish! I highly recomend this film! Great for the whole family!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I am a huge Wes Anderson fan and love the quirky heart of his films. But this one is special even in such company. Do yourself a favor.
All in all, not as good as his other works. Pretty boring sums it up. A little too weird for my tastes. I would pass on this one.

Until Moonrise Kingdom, The Royal Tennenbaums was my favorite Wes Anderson movie.  Moonrise has many of the same elements that made RT such a great movie:  Outstanding cast, great script, intricate sets, but Moonrise elevates them all into a charming examination of the human condition.

"Kingdom" is too grandiose.  Call it a neighborhood.

Wes Anderson's films always remind me of the saying about Chinese food:  you feel full enough while seated at the table, but half an hour later you're hungry again.

I would like to like this movie.  In fact, I'd like to like several of Wes Anderson's movies.  They generally start with an intriguing premise and a talented cast.  Opening scenes promise a strong story, characters we can relate to, situations that touch our emotions.  But then, somewhere along the line, the storyline blurs, characters lose their focus, connections between scenes become tenuous or downright missing.  The original concept becomes muddied, the victim of a director who can't seem to maintain his interest in a central theme for enough minutes to add up to a feature film.

Moonrise Kingdom is like a book you pick up expecting a novel and instead find yourself reading a collection of vaguely related short stories.  There's no lack of humor or cleverness or emotional highlights.  But the pieces don't add up to a whole.  Call it light entertainment, which has its place in the world, to be sure, but it's disappointing if you're looking for in-depth character development or intellectual stimulation or cinematic excellence.

What is it with this director?  The story is very good, but everyone sounds like they're reading from a page and the buildings don't look real.  Kids don't pose like that, people don't walk like that, nothing seems natural at all.  I guess that's fine if you are into Wes Anderson.

Its slow start with understated humor pulled me in. Its ability to poke fun at all kinds of institutions we hold dear made me like it. Its quiet examination of how we raise brilliant children made me love it. At times I laughed so hard I had to pause the movie. Moonrise Kingdom is a sleeper on par with Princess Bride.

I downloaded this movie to watch on my return airplane trip. (I was one of the options on the way across country, but no movies were offered on the way home.)  It was very quirky, but entertaining.  It helped pass the time. Not a theater price attraction.

The movie is more bs than turkey bacon...

It was more awkward than a family vacation to a nudist colony.

A real joy of a film. Wes Anderson created a delightful slightly off kilter world where the mundane becomes monumental and this movie very much reminded me of the "The Great American Fourth of July and Other Disasters". Anderson always seems to draw the best from the actors in his films but he's really outdone himself here. I don't think any actor stole the show but its amazing that this is the first film roles for the two primary child actors.

This is the best example I've seen of what I call "iconic directing" (which is Anderson's unmistakable style) in which there are a lot of still camera shots of subjects, beautifully framed (often with symmetrical surroundings) and often still or hardly moving. Sometimes the camera moves only laterally while it surveys a scene. The subjects in these scenes are like icons of an idea or of humans or personality types. It is as if Anderson is trying to deliver a cinematic art museum complete with Mona Lisa shots: the still shots of lovely Suzy (Kara Hayward) staring into the camera, and even a museum guide, narrator Bob Balaban.

This is in stark contrast with  "I want you in the room with them" style of directing done with hand held camera action - the best example IMO being the very remarkable film `Biutiful". In such films it's not icons but real people in your face.

The story is a kind of fairy tale, of course, but amusingly and charmingly presented with the great music of Benjamin Britten adding to the artful atmosphere. But it is the directing with its beautifully framed images, even more than the cute adolescent love story, that is well worth the ticket price.
Really good.  A quirky film.  Hard to describe.  Good actors and interesting characters. Highly recommended.  Will buy the blu ray. :)
Quirky but not very funny. One scene with some child pono. I like the cast, but the script was not funny.

Honestly, the rest of Wes Anderson's film all are above this one.  Moonrise Kingdom is my least favorite, would not watch it again. The sexualization of the children was very disturbing to watch as an adult...and I don't think that was the point.

The cast was, of course, phenomenal but the dialogue and delivery was off.  It was as if he was trying to make a quick version of his past films.  The costumes, sets, and cinematography were excellent and made the film watchable.

And I hated the scene where the dog was killed, that was uncalled for and very unnecessary to the plot.

Rear product coming from Hollywood. Throwback to the stories from fifties and sixties. Great actors tell story rarely seen coming from American cinematographers. Worm family comedy that looks like fantasy but can relate to almost any family.
did not like it at all. if possible, i would like a refund, how can so many people rate this 4 of 5 stars?
It was a bit off the wall but so entertaining. I loved the eccentric nature of the movie. All the actors were wonderful. I would definitely recommend watching.
Same feel as The Royal Tanenbaums.  Same writers and directors.  This is possibly a movie for a depressed viewer.  I enjoyed this better than the last few flicks made by the brothers.
Great storyline, acting, and the cinematography is amazing.  Another classic Wes Anderson film.  This would be one of my top 5 movies for the year.

This is a really cute movie that was made here in Rhode Island last summer.  It had a wonderful cast and the story is cute and fun, about a couple of kids who run away from their strange families so they can be together.
Great example of a Wes Anderson film. Heartwarming and funny. The film accomplishes being quirky and strange while also being grounded and real.

I absolutely love this movie. The first time I saw it, I left the theatre with a renewed belief in true love and scouting, even though I don't think I ever stopped believing in either. Wes Anderson is a unique director, but you can see his hand in every single shot of this film. It's artful, quirky, and lots of fun.

This movie is quite different from the trailer, which makes it seem like a comedy... it's not a comedy, although there are some laugh out loud moments.  It's a sweet charming coming of age film about 2 odd kids who find each other and try to run away together.  The set design, the color, the acting all reflect the quirky story.  I highly recommend it if you are looking for a sweet film that will leave you smiling.
This movie is the perfect combination of wit, creativity, and a classic feel. A lively score and divine cinematography bring the film to life. A stunning story of Suzy and Sam.
I was very bored throughout the film. I felt like some of the actors were good but the film was boring. Not my preference.

This was such a cute movie, both of us liked it a lot. Lots of whit and charm. One the order of Sandlot, cute, charming and witty hummor . We would watchint again, we do not watch many movies more than once. I would highly recomend.

Wes Anderson is hit-or-miss for me - I liked Rushmore and Fantastic Mr. Fox, but didn't care for The Life Aquatic or The Royal Tenenbaums. I even watched the trailer for this first, and wasn't sure I was going to like it. However, I was pleasantly surprised. "Moonrise Kingdom" is a really good movie - fun, heartwarming, yet quirky (as you would expect from and Anderson movie.)
I like this movie and, finally, found a movie that both of my grandsons (5 & 10 yrs) enjoyed watching - start to finish. Moonrise Kingdom
I thought the movie was going to be a comedy obviously not/ the acting was good however actual vs preview was very different
A delightful coming of age movie with an all star cast and an all star script. This is one of those movies that really takes it home for those who felt they were oddballs growing up.
Wes Anderson fans will not be displeased. Wonderful story-line, great cast, perfect cinematography, What else can you say?  His movies just get better and better.

Wes Anderson flicks are quirky fun and this one is no different. Based on the previews, we couldn't quite tell what it was about - but it did not disappoint. If you thought The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou was worth your time, then you'll likely feel that way about this movie as well.

Watch the trailer. If you like it, do not miss this movie! The movie is like the trailer but even better. That's pretty rare but very true in this case.

To be honest, while this is one of the best movies I've seen, most people I know wouldn't like it. Also someone with no memories of that era would have to miss a little of the richness of this masterpiece. Realistic in a way but more artistic in that it is a lie that tells the truth. And it does so beautifully.

GREAT in the way that so many Wes Anderson movies are great.  No one would mistake this as anything but one of his films, but this time it is even more beautiful and interesting because the main characters are kids. How cool is that? It's funny and heartwarming and awkward in all the right ways.
This is a typical Wes Anderson film, which means I like it.  If you don't care for off-beat films and off-beat humor, this one is not for you.

Sure it's a story about young and old love, about the boredom of marriage, about the weird kids ( and adults ) trying to fit in...but is it so fresh and so beautifully acted and photographed. It's totally over the top and yet there is such subtlety in the acting.  It's improbable and yet totally possible.  Bill Murray is a revelation of nuance.  I bought this movie after I saw it- beause I want it in my film library.

Even with some great actors, this movie is bizarre.  The plot centers around two misfit children who run away and fall in love.  Should twelve year-olds be involved in such an intimate relationship?  I think not.

I brought this DVD home to watch because it seemed exactly like the kind of movie I would love: retro, cute, quirky, eclectic and amusing.  "Moonrise Kingdom" tried to be all of those things, but fell far short of the mark.  The movie tried so hard to be those things, in fact, that it was annoying to watch.  The sets and costumes were so overly stylized as to be trite and contrived.  The dialogue was dry and mono-toned, so much so that it seemed that all of the characters were on opiates.  (They weren't)  The characters were weak and undeveloped; you never really cared about any of them or what happened to them.

Years ago, Wes Anderson pulled off a huge success very nicely with "The Royal Tennenbaums", a dry, offbeat story about dysfunctional characters.  He did not manage to recreate the ambiance and delight of that great movie in "Moonrise Kingdom". The thing that irritated me the most what the use and overuse of Hank Williams' songs throughout the movie.  As an ardent Hank Williams fan, I did not appreciate hearing his great songs bastardized as an inept and ineffective movie score. For one thing, the classic Hank Williams songs evoke the nostalgia of the 1940's and early 1950's, not the mid-1960's.  The use of his iconic songs was one thing that actually ruined this movie for me.
